PAD_ShadowheartComment.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartComment.text: Those people... the mind flayer made them its puppets.

session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartComment: Shadowheart realises that some people encountered near the nautiloid crash are being enthralled by an injured mind flayer and have no control over their actions.

AD_KilledMindflayer.speaker: Player
AD_KilledMindflayer.text: Monster. Death is too good for it.

session_synopses.AD_KilledMindflayer: The party comments after killing the mind flayer that lay dying in the wreckage.
session_synopses.PAD_SeeWoundedDevourers: You meet with some Intellect Devourers: walking brains essentially that are nasty creatures. They attack you. As non-gith you have no idea what these things are. As gith, you know very well.

PAD_DeadGuide.speaker: Player
PAD_DeadGuide.text: The githyanki from the mind flayer ship. A shame he didn't survive.

session_synopses.PAD_DeadGuide: PAD for when players get closer to the alternative guide's corpse at the crash site. The guide is a gith mage the replaces Lae'zel in the tutorial introduction if Lae'zel is an avatar (he knows Lae'zel). After tutorial ends and players wake up, his corpse will appear nearby (he didn't get magically saved when falling).

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: "elicited" = "el-iss-it-ed": a soft C, not a hard one.

session_synopses.Dead: You speak with the dead soul of a fisherman, who tells you where you are: on a river that flows to Baldur's Gate. However, you're probably too far away to get there before the worm in your brain transforms you into a mindflayer.

PAD_Jetty.speaker: Player
PAD_Jetty.text: Fresh water. There must be a settlement somewhere nearby.

PAD_Jetty.speaker: Player
PAD_Jetty.text: Let's hope the locals are friendly.

session_synopses.PAD_Jetty: Player comes near the end of a jetty that looks over the Chiontar.

Dead.speaker: Abducted Nobleman
Dead.text: Guiding my cart... shadow fell... tentacle grabbed me...

Dead.speaker: Abducted Nobleman
Dead.text: Took me here... put something in my eye...

session_synopses.Dead: You speak with the dead soul of a merchant, who was kidnapped by the mindflayers and died in the crash. The player can offer to help bury the body or perform any last rites, but they'll be rebuked by the spirit.

VB_LowerFloor_1.speaker: Player
VB_LowerFloor_1.text: This place wasn't built for the living.
VB_LowerFloor_1.context: NodeContext: Karlach: She's enjoying exploring here.

PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.speaker: Player
PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.text: They didn't want to surrender their valuables, even after death.

VB_SideChamber_1.speaker: Player
VB_SideChamber_1.text: Looks like someone wanted to bury their secrets.

AD_BanditGuardWarning.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardWarning.context: NodeContext: He's in an abandoned chapel, looting, and has just spotted the players. He calls to his friends for help and enters combat

AD_JergalInsideTomb.speaker: Richly Adorned Sarcophagus
AD_JergalInsideTomb.text: Dost thou think to rush fate? See to the dead first.

AD_BanditSanctumSearching.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.text: Rotten food, dusty altars... where's the bloody treasure?
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.context: NodeContext: Referring to his surroundings in an abandoned chapel. He's searching for a way to open the crypt, or some treasure. Muttering to himself

AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.context: NodeContext: spotted the player - shouting to alert her companions as she becomes hostile

PAD_GasPit.speaker: Player
PAD_GasPit.text: I can't see any way to disarm it.

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in an adjacent room just collapsed, startling them

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditCrashBanter.text: The roof caved in - this place is a deathtrap!
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound, this guy is trying to take control of the situation and calm his companions

VB_Skeleton_1.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_1.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.context: NodeContext: alarmed - he's a tomb-robber in an abandoned chapel, and the players just surprised him. He's calling his friends to help as combat begins

AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.text: How'd you get past Andorn? Back off!
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.context: NodeContext: She was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel and is surprised to see the players who have either killed or sneaked past her friend 'Andorn'. She's entering combat.

AD_BanditGuardSurprised.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardSurprised.context: NodeContext: he's part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - the player just entered, surprising him. He calls for help as he backs away, in combat

VB_Artefact_1.speaker: Player
VB_Artefact_1.text: A lot of effort to hide one sarcophagus.
VB_Artefact_1.context: NodeContext: Said with reverence and a touch of fear.

VB_Sanctum_1.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_1.text: No more prayers... only silence and dust.
VB_Sanctum_1.context: NodeContext: player reflects on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel. Possibly quietly reverential; it's a holy place

AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.speaker: Player
AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.text: No lock, no handle. How does it open?
AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.context: NodeContext: found a door without a lock or handle

PAD_FoundCoins.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundCoins.text: A strange coin. I wonder what it's worth.

AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.text: Not even sure this is a door.
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.context: NodeContext: Confused - trying to unlock a door in an abandoned chapel that doesn't actually have a lock. She's struggling and muttering to herself

VB_Skeleton_2.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_2.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

VB_Skeleton_2.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_2.text: I wonder what was so subversive about their words that they commanded protection.
VB_Skeleton_2.context: NodeContext: player reacts to companion commenting that skeletons in an abandoned chapel appear to have died without a fight. Slightly unnerved

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: This place is falling apart - could've happened by itself.

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Haseid
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: No such thing as coincidences when there's loot to be had.

Jergal.text: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player
Jergal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: So he has spoken, and so thou standest before me. Right as always.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: What a curious way to awaken.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Now I have a question for thee: what is the worth of a single mortal's life?

Jergal.speaker: Player
Jergal.text: A peaceful undead. Interesting. Why aren't you attacking me?

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Dull your weapons as you wish.

AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.text: It's... open? Could've sworn I hadn't cracked it.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.speaker: Player
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.text: Oh, hells. Something just woke up...
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.context: NodeContext: just picked up an artefact and heard something awakening in response down in a dungeon - afraid, but with resolve

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.text: I know when I've got a lock beaten and I didn't beat this one.

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.text: Maybe it just broke by itself. This place is ancient.
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.context: NodeContext: Further weak effort at explaining the unexplainable.

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.text: Maybe. But keep on your guard.
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.context: NodeContext: Cautious. Something doesn't add up.

PAD_JergalStatueReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_JergalStatueReaction.text: That statue. It seems they worshipped some kind of... scholar?

AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.text: Barton? Oh gods, somebody killed Barton!
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.context: NodeContext: just found a dead friend - Barton - and is furious as she starts to hunt for the killer

VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.text: No more prayers... only dust and silence.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.text: Who were those prayers for? Normally the patron god is obvious - not here.

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: We have nothing more to discuss. Continue on thy way, as if I were not here.

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: I must attend this place, after so many years away. We will see each other again soon.

JergalWandering.speaker: Player
JergalWandering.text: You seem very certain of that. How?

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: The mechanics of fate would be difficult to explain to one such as thyself.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_2_WithShadowheart.speaker: Player
VB_TakingTheArtefact_2_WithShadowheart.text: Hells... something just woke up down here.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_2_WithShadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_TakingTheArtefact_2_WithShadowheart.text: Let them come. The darkness can be to our advantage.

AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.text: Clear off - we got here first!
AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.context: NodeContext: seeing a threat, preparing to attack

session_synopses.VB_LowerFloor_1: This triggers has the player unlocks a door and enters a secret and, until now, hidden crypt.
session_synopses.PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing: Voicebark dialog after robbing the amulet from Jergal chapel, about whether it was right to loot the place. Its guardians might have been killed by the player. Or the guardians might have engaged the player, but they found a way to get out without killing them all, by fleeing or distracting them. Or the player might have sneakily escape the guardians.This is played on the party after they leave an area, so Speakers are roughly interchangeable here, the undertaking is assumed to be a party effort.
session_synopses.VB_SideChamber_1: VB upon noticing the book chained and padlocked to the table in the side room.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardWarning: A bandit who is part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - at this point, he's seen the players entering the chapel - 'the uninvited guests' - and thinks they're after the same loot as his crew. He's calling his friends to help.
session_synopses.AD_JergalInsideTomb: Jergal reacts to a player touching his sarcophagus when his servants (the skeletal clerics) have not yet been killed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumSearching: A bandit in an abandoned chapel who is searching around an altar for a way to open a passage into the crypt, which is in the corridor outside. He's frustrated, twitchy and nervous. This place is creepy.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked: A bandit in an abandoned chapel calls to her companions for help upon spotting the player
session_synopses.PAD_GasPit: Player characters comment when the player interacts with a trap that has been spotted but not yet triggered
session_synopses.AD_BanditCrashBanter: A group of bandits in an abandoned chapel - they're hoping to loot the place and are a little on edge. Abandoned chapels often have traps or undead guardians. they're startled by a loud noise from one of the side-chambers. The roof just caved in, and the bandit are trying to figure out a plan of action. What they don't know is that the roof collapse was caused by the players who just broke in.
session_synopses.VB_Skeleton_1: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardCallHelp: One of a group of bandits looting an abandoned chapel. He's just been surprised by the players who have infiltrated the same chapel. He's twitchy and on edge, and now he's in a fight and needs his friends.
session_synopses.PAD_ButtonBlocked: The player has pressed a button only to find it won't move - because it deactivates a trap they haven't triggered yet.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting: A bandit who was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel - at this point, she's seen the players intruding on her position and tries to alert her friends as she enters combat
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardSurprised: A bandit guarding the door to an abandoned chapel that his crew are looting. The player just surprised him and he calls for help as he enters combat
session_synopses.VB_Artefact_1: Players notice the tomb containing the Selune artefact.
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_1: players reflect on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel
session_synopses.AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation: player finds a door that has no lock or handle
session_synopses.PAD_FoundCoins: Player finds a soul coin inside Jergal's chapel.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking: A bandit in an abandoned chapel - she's trying and failing to open a door to the lower level of the chapel, searching for loot. Talking to herself as she struggles - confused by the fact the door doesn't have a lock.
session_synopses.VB_Skeleton_2: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert: Three bandits - Barton, Mari and Haseid - are on alert in a crypt they're attempting to rob. They heard a commotion (falling masonry) and are braced for threats.
session_synopses.Jergal: After the party has slain a group of undead scholars, the judge of death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor: Mari realises that the door she was trying to unlock is suddenly opened, but she has not unlocked it.
session_synopses.VB_TakingTheArtefact_1: The player just stole a relic from a crypt in an abandoned chapel, and all candles around it sputtered out. Sounds of movement come from another room...
session_synopses.AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter: Mari has found the door to lower level open but she did not unlock it. She talks to her comrade, Barton about it.They debate what must have happened.
session_synopses.PAD_JergalStatueReaction: Player succeeds/fails passive check to recognise statue of Jergal.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit: A bandit in an abandoned chapel finds one of her companions dead
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart: Players have entered an abandoned chapel dedicated to an unknown god. Shadowheart is puzzled as to why she can't figure out who was the patron of this place.
session_synopses.JergalWandering: death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.
session_synopses.VB_TakingTheArtefact_2_WithShadowheart: The player just stole a relic from a crypt in an abandoned chapel, and all candles around it sputtered out. Sounds of movement come from another room... Shadowheart is with the party
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumSpotting: The bandit in the chapel's inner sanctum spots the player and starts combat.
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumAlert: Barton is alerted and tells the other bandits inside the room to get ready in their positions.

PAD_Jewelry.speaker: Player
PAD_Jewelry.text: Necklace has a Harper sigil. Why were they here?

Crevice.speaker: Narrator
Crevice.text: *At the back of the crevice lies a bag, enfolded in the chitinous squabbling of spiders. A shiny gold coin pokes from its mouth.*
Crevice.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks into the crevice. We see a bag at the bottom with a coin sticking out.

Crevice.speaker: Narrator
Crevice.text: *The creatures clutch the pouch possessively. You have no doubt: a spider egg is nestled within.*

Crevice.speaker: Player
Crevice.text: Dart your hand in, hoping to snatch the bag.

Crevice.speaker: Narrator
Crevice.text: *Pincers pierce your flesh, and pain shoots up your arm and across your back.*

session_synopses.PAD_Jewelry: Player finds a necklace at the watchtower. If they pass a History check, they recognize it as belonging to the Harpers. If they encountered the Harper documents hidden in the CRA cave, the player senses a pattern.
session_synopses.Crevice: The player peeks into a crevice to see a coin pouch covered in small spiders.

PAD_Door.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Door.text: Won't get that open easily. Maybe there's another entrance.

session_synopses.PAD_Door: Shadowheart comments as a companion on another character trying to open the exterior door to Jergal's crypt.

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: You'll die a bloody pauper unless you take a few risks.

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Taman
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: Why don't we just wait a while? Make sure it's safe.

VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.text: There! Not so impregnable after all.
VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.context: NodeContext: Satisfied. She's just successfully lockpicked a large, heavy set of doors.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Warryn
BanditWestInteraction.text: You! Not another step, hear me?
BanditWestInteraction.context: NodeContext: Sharp ultimatum mixed with a little surprise. Found the player approaching from the side of the structure.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Warryn
BanditWestInteraction.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hollering down to Gimblebock, his leader (down some steps behind Warryn, out of view).NodeContext: Hollering down to Gimblebock, his leader (down some steps behind Warryn, out of view)

BanditWestInteraction.text: CinematicNodeContext: Alerted by Warryn, Gimblebock hurries up to confront the player
BanditWestInteraction.context: CinematicNodeContext: Alerted by Warryn, Gimblebock hurries up to confront the player

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction.text: What's this then - trying to creep around us and loot the crypt? Not happening.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction.text: Or is it the ship you're after? Don't matter either way - it's ours, all of it.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Player
BanditWestInteraction.text: I think that ship's an invasion force. Run while you can!

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction.text: You're all hot air - think you can get us to leave that bounty to you? Not a chance!
BanditWestInteraction.context: NodeContext: Looking down on the player (figuratively, not literally) - we tried to scare him away, but he won't be intimidated. He's going to attack soon.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction.text: What're you lot waiting for? Get 'em!
BanditWestInteraction.context: NodeContext: Ordering his underlings to kill the player.

AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.speaker: Quelenna
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.text: Well, that's one less greedy bastard to share the loot with.
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: with a shrug - found a dead companion and sees the bright side

AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.speaker: Taman
AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.text: We'd have been safer in the crypt!
AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: reacting with shock on seeing a dead friend

session_synopses.AD_BanditsDiscussion: Discussion between Gimbleboc and Taman before the scene against them triggers. They're arguing about whether to investigate the crash (this segues into the beginning of their intertactive dialogue when you get near enough)
session_synopses.VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe: Shadowheart lockpicked the crypt door that she usually try to bash.
session_synopses.AD_BanditReaction: A bandit exclaims in alarm/indignity upon spotting the player 'trespassing' near a tomb they intended to loot.
session_synopses.VB_Fissure_1: The player notices a gap in the flooring of an ancient chapel. There's faint signs of something else below.
session_synopses.BanditWestInteraction: Alternate version of the confrontation scene between Gimblebock and his bandits at the crypt - triggers if the player approaches the scene from the side, alerting Warryn first.
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction: A bandit reacts to finding one of her companions dead in an apparent accident. She looks on the bright side.
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction: A bandit sees the corpse of one of his companions, killed by a falling boulder
session_synopses.Bandit_Melee_01_Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Gimblebock - the leader of the bandits who're looting the ruined chapel near where the player first wakes up. Gimblebock's answers are fragmented, cryptic. He can only draw on info that he knew when he was alive, and will refuse to speak to his killer if he recognises them. After a maximum of five questions, he'll fall silent for good.

AD_OutsideStatue.speaker: Player
AD_OutsideStatue.text: Text is too faded. Doesn't tell me who was worshipped here.
AD_OutsideStatue.context: NodeContext: Players with religious classes comment on the plaque.

AD_FL1Mural.speaker: Narrator
AD_FL1Mural.context: NodeContext: Narrator describes a plaque written in a dead language

AD_FL1Mural.speaker: Player
AD_FL1Mural.text: A dead tongue. Whoever worshipped here must be long gone.

session_synopses.AD_OutsideStatue: The player tries to read a bronze plaque at the foot of an unidentified statue.
session_synopses.AD_FL1Mural: The player reads a plaque attached to a statue of Selune, the moon goddess. Shadowheart casually mocks it.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.speaker: Damays
AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.text: Eyes on the toad-freak. We can't risk it escaping.

AD_TieflingsLeaving.speaker: Damays
AD_TieflingsLeaving.text: Observe - and listen. You'll hear goblins before you see them.

AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.text: They must have carried something useful.

AD_OpenCage1.speaker: Nymessa
AD_OpenCage1.text: Shoot it down. Let's kill this thing.

AD_LaeZelDead.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelDead.text: Hold it together. We've got to finish what we started.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: And when the goblins ally with it?

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Nymessa
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: We'll be on the road to Baldur's Gate.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: When this thing strikes, there will be no soldiers to protect you. This isn't Elturel.

AD_LeavingAnyCombat1.speaker: Nymessa
AD_LeavingAnyCombat1.text: I can't stay here. It's too dangerous.

PickASide.speaker: Lae'zel
PickASide.text: Prove you're not a craven. Join me, or die.
PickASide.context: InternalNodeContext: The player took their leave in the dialog, or perhaps they failed all the persuasions, so the tieflings are acting on their own and wants to bring Lae'zel to camp

PickASide.speaker: Lae'zel
PickASide.text: You've but one chance. Join me, or die.
PickASide.context: InternalNodeContext: The player persuaded the tieflings that they should kill the creature

TieflingsScene.speaker: Nymessa
TieflingsScene.text: Zorru was right. Yellow as a toad, and twice as ugly.
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Nymessa
TieflingsScene.text: You're coming with me, 'fore... Oh! Looks like I've got company.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Lae'zel
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.InternalNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene.text: This creature is dangerous. Get out of here - leave it to me!

TieflingsScene.speaker: Nymessa
TieflingsScene.text: You're right. I need to go check out that blast.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene.text: A blast? Care to be more specific?

TieflingsScene.speaker: Nymessa
TieflingsScene.text: You didn't hear it? Shook our camp good, so I came for a look.

session_synopses.AD_LaezelReactsToAttack: Lae'zel is in the cage. The player attacked her.
session_synopses.AD_ReturnAnyCombat2: Damays (and Nymessa) got dragged into a combat from another situation (ex.: the brains at the crash site, the bandits at the chapel). Damays plays this AD when the combat ends, while he returns to the cage.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingsLeaving: Two tieflings discussing goblins, who might be nearby.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses: Damays and Nymessa are dead. Lae'zel says this once, then will inspect the corpses.
session_synopses.AD_OpenCage1: A tiefling encourages you to shoot down a cage containing a strange creaturfe (Lae'zel).
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelDead: Two tieflings that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comment that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro: Two tieflings argue about what to do with Lae'zel. Nymessa thinks to leave her alone. Damays wants to take her back to camp.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelDeadSolo2: A tiefling that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comments that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_OtherDied2: Damays reacts to the death of nymessa at Lae'zel recruitment.
session_synopses.AD_LeavingAnyCombat1: |Tieflings joined a random combat and were dragged far from Lae'zel Recruitment. They will leave out of stage while saying this instead of going back to the scene.|
session_synopses.PickASide: Occurs if the player tells the tieflings to lower Lae'zel and kill her, or if player lets the tieflings try to take her away. One last chance to choose a side.
session_synopses.TieflingsScene: You come upon Lae'zel, an alien-looking githyanki trapped in a cage, with two tieflings deciding her fate. Damays thinks its best to take it back to camp to keep an eye on. Nymessa wants to just leave it alone. If Shadowheart is present, she'll warn the player to not trust Lae'zel (she doesn't trust gith due to previous experiences while on a secret mission against them, but doesn't elaborate).
session_synopses.AD_OpenCageLaezel: Lae'zel is still hanging in her cage. She calls to you to let her down.

VB_Trap.speaker: Player
VB_Trap.text: And yet another. Hardly the warmest of welcomes.

session_synopses.VB_Trap: You click on a broken trap on the ground and find it useless.

HeadedToCave.speaker: Zevlor
HeadedToCave.text: Find me in the caves. I need to let people know we're moving.
HeadedToCave.context:
InternalNodeContext: Player clicks on Zevlor while he is getting back to his default position in the cave after the confrontation.
When Zevlor finally reaches the cave, his dialog is switched to DEN_TieflingLeader

PAD_ZevlorsMap.speaker: Player
PAD_ZevlorsMap.text: Looks like we're in Elturgard. Some distance from the city of Baldur's Gate.
PAD_ZevlorsMap.context: NodeContext: Karlach, grumbling about being so far from BG

PAD_ZevlorsMap.speaker: Player
PAD_ZevlorsMap.text: Gnolls and goblins marked on the map. Travel won't be easy.

session_synopses.AD_Victory: Plays after the tieflings won Attack on Den or after completing Goblin Hunt. Zevlor is standing on the plateform above the gate of the Grove and he's watching the other tieflings below.
session_synopses.HeadedToCave: |Zevlor's default dialog need a timeline context, so this dialog here is used as a transition when Zevlor is walking back to his default spot after a big event happened in the Grove. There's 2 cases: after the raiding party and after druid attack.|
session_synopses.PAD_ZevlorsMap: |Player clicked on Zevlor's map (a map of Elturgard that shows the road to Baldur's Gate). Zevlor will likely have drawn on it.|

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: Stop it! You're not going to find the antidote.

Apprentice.speaker: Player
Apprentice.text: Then help me. Give me a chance to beat this.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: I can't. I can't let you endanger this camp.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: Please, just sit down. Make your prayers. Let things take their course.

session_synopses.Apprentice: The player is locked in Nettie's lab and has done something to annoy her (ie. Stolen, damaged, or moved something she owned, or been caught trying to pick her pocket.) Nettie has poisoned the player, and is wary of you finding the antidote while looking around.

PAD_Comment.speaker: Player
PAD_Comment.text: Looks like the ritual worked. The whole grove is walled in.
PAD_Comment.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Sad. tieflings trapped inside.

PAD_Attack.speaker: Player
PAD_Attack.text: It'd take an age to hack through all this.

session_synopses.PAD_Comment: This VB plays when players first see the results of a druid ritual: indestructible vines have enveloped the entire grove, sealing it off from the outside world. Players cannot get past them to the grove within.
session_synopses.PAD_Attack: This VB plays when players attack the indestructible vines that have enveloped a druid's grove.

session_synopses.AD_2: This is Bex's AD if Danis is dead or occupied. She should be slightly uneasy as a result.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: And we'll have a dog, right?
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: They don't allow 'em in Baldur's Gate. Cats, though...
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: A little orange cat! And a house with a little door so it can come and go as it pleases.
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: ... and a high fence to keep eavesdroppers out.
2.context:
NodeContext: Just now noticing the player. Following Bex's line: 'And a house with a little door so it can come and go as it pleases.' A little wary but not too bad
-- who is this perosn who's approached them?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Don't mind me. I was just passing through.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: No bother. We're just daydreaming, anyhow.
2.context: NodeContext: Friendly again-- player doesn't mean harm.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: What about you? Big plans for when you get to the city?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I'll be keeping to myself. People tend to stare at me.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: But... I've heard there's all sorts in the city. It might not be like it was in Elturel. I mean - in Baldur's Gate, they give you a chance.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: Good luck to you. Wish us a little too. I think we'll all need it.

session_synopses.2: This pair are a young couple dreaming about their future plans in Baldur's Gate. They're optimistic-- as long as they have each other, they'll make things work. Early/ mid-20s, youthful enthusiasm.

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Narrator
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: *Your rescue attempt has been noticed. Choose your next move carefully.*

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Player
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: Anyone who wants to hurt Sazza will face me first.

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Narrator
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: *You are persuasive enough. You, and the goblin, are free to go.*

GroveConflict_IdolCrime.speaker: Narrator
GroveConflict_IdolCrime.text: *It seems the Idol of Silvanus has been stolen. Choose your next move carefully.*

session_synopses.CapturedGoblin_Crime: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player is trying to smuggle the goblin out of the Druid Grove.
session_synopses.GroveConflict_IdolCrime: The player has stolen a most sacred idol from the druids.Though the druids have made peace with the players and the tieflings at this time, they can't let anyone steal their idol, so they interrogate the player when they see him.

session_synopses.AD_004: Animal sound AD for pet boar in druid grove

Telescope.speaker: Narrator
Telescope.context: CinematicNodeContext: player sees the landscape ahead through the telescope lens - the dragon is gone

Telescope.speaker: Player
Telescope.text: Focus the telescope on the distant object, trying to get a clear view.

Telescope.speaker: Narrator
Telescope.text: *You see a dragon circling like a bird of prey. Hunting.*
Telescope.context: NodeContext: watching the dragon through a telescope so fear but no immediate danger

session_synopses.Telescope: The player interacts with a telescope at a druid grove, looking out at the scenery and potentially spotting a dragon in the sky.

Resting.speaker: Narrator
Resting.text: *The adventurer sleeps soundly, his breath steady, his wounds expertly bandaged.*

session_synopses.Resting: Small dialogue when you find Liam sleeping in the den after freeing him in the goblin camp.

AD_GreetingPlayer.speaker: Asharak
AD_GreetingPlayer.context: NodeContext: Introducing the player to his students.

session_synopses.AD_GreetingPlayer: Trainer introducing the player to the class. The player has just walked up.

AD_Ritual.speaker: Aelar, Karrik, Inwe, Tahan, Elwyn
AD_Ritual.context: NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Ahb SPEE-ree-too oo-MOHK, AH-coo-lay-oos VEE-tees-kway.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Find our master. Return to me then.
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to the bird. NodeContext: Stern but also love in her voice. She knows the bird will do its best.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Tell me what you find. Tell only me. Understand?

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Tingmiaq
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hopping from foot NodeContext: Cheerful, excited.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: We wasted so much time fighting each other.
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The danger has passed, but there was much infighting in the druid grove, which he believes put them at higher risk.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: Silvanus taught us a lesson by letting an outsider save us.
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: Players are the outsider here - they saved the druid grove from both infighting and a goblin attack.

RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3.text: To think we almost finished the ritual...
RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would have sealed off the druid grove from outsiders and driven out the tieflings is over. She's ashamed to have been a part of it.

RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3.text: I felt honoured when I was chosen to participate. Now I feel guilty I didn't object.
RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would have sealed off the druid grove from outsiders and driven out the tieflings is over. She's ashamed to have been a part of it.

AD_RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
AD_RitualDruid1.text: Complexum tuum... it's still in my head.
AD_RitualDruid1.context: NodeContext: Prnounced: Com-PLECK-soom TOO-oom, He's got a chant stuck in his head.

AD_RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
AD_RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblins threat against the grove has been defeated. Inwe is still scared - she's not convinced the threat is really gone.

AD_RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
AD_RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat is dealt with. Tahani is bitter - she blames players and tiefling for bringing trouble to the grove in the first place.

AD_RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
AD_RitualDruid4.text: The grove isn't safe. Not anymore.
AD_RitualDruid4.context: NodeContext: The ritual to seal the druid grove off and drive out the refugees has been stopped, but goblins still threaten the grove. Elwyn worries that without Kagha - the mastermind of the ritual - they are rudderless, easy targets.

session_synopses.AD_BirdSender: |Druid sending a bird to find Halsin. |
session_synopses.AD_Ritual: Five druids participate in a ritual around a sacred pool. The chant will summon a coccoon of thorns that will encircle their entire grove. Lines play sequentially, each druid saying one line, then the next, etc.They're chanting at a normal to low volume. They're attempting to suss power out from the earth itself, but they're not forcing it out. There should be a loose rhythm to it (think Arwen from LoTR when she summons the river horses), but it shouldn't come across like a drum circle.
session_synopses.AD_SearchingBird: |Talking to her friend and companion, a bird. She wants it to fly over the area and search for her missing master, Halsin. |
session_synopses.RitualDruid2: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Kerrick is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Kerrick is furious - he feels betrayed by Kagha, and doesn't quite care if she's been killed.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Kerrick has calmed down a good bit - now that the danger's passed, he's seeing things with a bit more clarity. The player always encounters Kerrick around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.RitualDruid3: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Inwe is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Inwe is ashamed at her involvement.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Inwe is still a bit shaken - she knows the threat is over, but she's still jumping at shadows.The player always encounters Inwe around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid1: This AD plays after the druid's ritual has been stopped. In this AD, Aelar is dazed from days of chanting.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid3: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Inwe was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Inwe is feeling sorry for herself. She's overcome with shame for being a part of a shadow druid plot.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Inwe isn't quite convinced the danger is over. She's jumping at shadows, imagining danger where there's presumably none.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid5: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Tahani was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In both states, Tahani is bitter, muttering her xenophobic ideas to herself. She thinks the tieflings (and the player) are the cause of all their troubles and that they should've been thrown out a long time ago.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid4: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Elwyn was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Elwyn is preoccupied with the goblins - she's afraid that without the protection the ritual would have provided, they don't have a chance against them.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Elwyn is calm, the weight of the goblin threat finally off her shoulders.

DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolTampered.text: The Idol of Silvanus! Round up the intruders - we've been patient enough.

RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Kanon
RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.text: VO_SFX: Death cry - While turning the wheel to open the gate, Kanon gets hit by an arrow in the neck and dies

RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Remira
RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.text: VO_SFX description: Heavy lifting efforts to try to keep gate open (along with Aradin & Barth). It's too heavy so the gate slams shut

CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime.speaker: GROUP_Civilians, GROUP_Dwarves, GROUP_Elves, GROUP_Gith, GROUP_Guards, GROUP_Humans, GROUP_Tiefling
CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime.text: The goblin is escaping! Kill it!

session_synopses.DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolTampered: AD when the druids realise their sacred idol has been tampered with. This is the straw that breaks the camel's back, and they start attacking the tieflings and the players.
session_synopses.CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime: Assorted residents of the Druid Grove react to a goblin prisoner having broken free.

AD_StartingOver.speaker: Alfira
AD_StartingOver.context: NodeContext: Player has convinced her to start from scratch with the song. Doubts herself. Hates what she's working on. Dejected.

AD_InstrumentStolen.speaker: Alfira
AD_InstrumentStolen.text: Get away from me. I mean it!
AD_InstrumentStolen.context: NodeContext: Player has stolen her dead teacher's instrument. You're upset and yelling at the player.

AD_Dejected.speaker: Alfira
AD_Dejected.context: NodeContext: She has 'lost' her instrument (player stole it). You are on the brink of tears, feeling lost and ashamed - you wanted to write a song for your teacher, and now you never will. You feel like a failure.

session_synopses.AD_StartingOver: AD that plays after the bard has been told to start over. She is holding her lute. Not plucking it occasionally but not really playing.
session_synopses.AD_InstrumentStolen: The bard is sitting. Snaps at the player.
session_synopses.AD_Dejected: Dejected/crying because her instrument was stolen or smashed by a player.

session_synopses.Dead: In this dialogue, Volo has died and is a lifeless corpse. Rather than his usual jocular self, he's a shade who can hardly speak.

PostEA.speaker: Dammon
PostEA.text: Thanks for fighting off those goblins. If you need to replace any gear, just ask.

PostEA.speaker: Dammon
PostEA.text: My selection's pretty slim. I had to leave most of my equipment in Elturel.

PostEA.speaker: Player
PostEA.text: That forge is holding on by a thread. Are you a smith?

PostEA.speaker: Dammon
PostEA.text: Of sorts. Used to be a bread-and-butter tinsmith before Elturel fell into Avernus. These days my talents are more... eclectic.

PostEA.speaker: Dammon
PostEA.text: Learned a lot in my time in the Hells. Hope to forget most of it, but between you and me, there's nothing in all the realms like the utter power of infernal machinery.

PostEA.speaker: Dammon
PostEA.text: Alas - my offerings are far more humble these days.

session_synopses.PostEA: Players can approach a tiefling blacksmith. He used to have a proper forge in Elturel, but is now trying to make do in the grove. The gear he has available is usable, but not great.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Another outsider? This place has certainly become popular.
005.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arron turns around and wipes his hands on his trousers (he was standing at a table, with his back to the player).

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Well met, and thank you for beating back those goblins. Most brave of you.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Is there anything you need? Act fast if you do - the ritual will be complete before too long.

005.speaker: Player
005.text: What ritual are you talking about?

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Ah - I forgot you're a blow-in. A few days hence, this grove will be completely concealed by thorny vines.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: None will be able to enter - or leave.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: A drastic measure. But more monsters seem to terrorise this region every day.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: We druids will be safe. As for those that took refuge here... well, may Silvanus guard them as they continue their travels.

005.speaker: Player
005.text: Seems like most are tieflings. They'll be fine. They have devilish powers.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Ignorance is agony, my friend. I will include you in my prayers. I'd better get started - for your sake.

session_synopses.005: Arron is a friendly, but tired servant to the druids in the grove. Unless the player is a druid, he would rather they don't linger, though he is sympathetic and will help them any way he can (by selling them supplies). He is happy to see a druid and to help them. He can be a little preachy.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Why didn't we stop her? We should've stopped her!
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: Blaming yourself for your daughter's death

AD_Parents.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents.text: We didn't do this, do you hear me? It was Kagha.
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: You know where you husband's mind is going and you won't have it - firm, voice like still. Hint of violence.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Cursed druids. I hate them all.

Guard3.speaker: Mino
Guard3.text: Few outsiders are allowed in here - be respectful and do not interfere.
Guard3.context: NodeContext: 'tread on eggshells while you're here - or else.'

Guard2.speaker: Maggran
Guard2.context: NodeContext: SFX only - animal sound. Do not record.

Protester1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1.text: Lives are at stake, and the cowards only care about their bloody rituals!
Protester1.context: NodeContext: Spoken to the player re; the druids, who are still relatively close.

AD_ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
AD_ParentsScene.text: Step back - you sully our holy ground!

SoloParentA.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA.text: All Arabella wanted to do is help. But you and half the grove stood by and let her die - alone.

SoloParentA.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA.text: Get out of my sight. For your own good.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

Guard1.speaker: Jeorna
Guard1.text: Your companion vouched for you, but you're being watched. Respect our grove.
Guard1.context: NodeContext: Terse. The player's been granted entry but the guard isn't too welcoming.

session_synopses.AD_Parents: Situation 1: Locke and Marrick have learned their daughter is dead - killed by Sagha and her snake. Situation 2: Locke and Marrick have been denied entry into the inner grove. They are standing close to the entrance trying to figure out their next step. Marrick is happy to charge in but Locke is advising caution. Their daughter is inside.
session_synopses.Guard3: A druid guarding the entrance to the inner part of a sacred druid grove. He curtly warns the player to behave.
session_synopses.Guard2: Maggran (druid guarding the entrance to the inner sanctum of the Emerald Grove) is in bear form. He delivers curt, bestial one-liners if the player has speak with animals. He doesn't want them around. He has a lone human fallback line should he somehow transform.
session_synopses.Protester1: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsScene: (script comment: it is repeated, but I don't want it to be culled out)This occurs as the player approaches the scene. Locke and Marrick are arguing with two druid guards - trying to get in. Their daughter is inside but they are being denied entrance.Tensions are high and voices are raised. This is a tense exchange.
session_synopses.SoloParentA: This is for the edgecase in which one of the parents has died. In this case - Locke, the husband survives. In the first scenarion he rewards and thanks the player for saving his daughter's life - lamenting briefly on their lives without Arabella's mother.In the second, he learns that Arabella has died. He is overcome with grief and rage at losing both his wife and daughter.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsSeeCorpse: This is the edgecase in which the player takes Arabella's corpse and dumps it in front of her parents. They are hysterical with grief.
session_synopses.Guard1: Jeorna, one of the druid grove guards, speaks to the player after they've been allowed entry. She's curt and not greatly pleased that we're allowed inside.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: If it ain't the friendly drow. Thought you were with the goblins when you showed up at the gate.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Glad you weren't - you fight well. Not like them bloody tieflings.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I think they like you less than they like me. It's almost impressive, how detestable you are.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Thanks, mum. Now please do feck off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Thick with sarcasm

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Feck off yourself - I saved your skin back at the gates.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Yeah, you really saved the day, swooping in and playing the hero.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic and punchable

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Now I'm gonna take the blame for leading the goblins here, and losing track of the bloody druid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: He knows these things are his fault, but he's sulking and petulant about it

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Who's the druid you lost track of?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Halsin. He's the leader around these parts. Or was.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: We've got a contract to track down some relic, and he wanted in on the job. Eyes lit up when he heard about it.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Didn't work out, though. Goblins got him when we were turning tail. He's either diggin' latrines or boilin' in a cookpot by now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Did you think getting rich would be easy?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Dunno what I expected. That much gold for some long-lost relic. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: And from a wizard, too. I shoulda known. The gold probably turns to lead the moment you leave Baldur's Gate.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Stupid thing to die for...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dismissive

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: But gold ain't any use if you're too cold to spend it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Flippant

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Just tell me where to find the relic.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: It's called the Nightsong. Supposed to be hidden under the temple where the goblins jumped us.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: I'd give you the map and wish you a happy funeral, but my mate Brian kept hold of it like his own todger. Goblins made short of the fat old chunk.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Disrespectful

session_synopses: Adventurer leader dialogue. Mostly used during Adventurers Quest. This is after the player has stopped Zevlor and Aradin from fighting one another. Aradin returns to his den to lick his wounds.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Wyvern poison. Let's hope it doesn't come to that.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better a quick draught than ceremorphosis, nonetheless.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better to have on hand than not.

AD_Busy.speaker: Nettie
AD_Busy.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hand raised in a sign to wait and then turns back to what she was doing .NodeContext: Terse, impatient. She's dealing with serious matters right now.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: First you save us from goblins, then Kagha's treachery. You're making your mark.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.NodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Give me a moment. I'll be right with you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the playerNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Excuse me? I'm more important than some bird.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: God or fieldmouse, no one's more important than the patient in front of you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still working on the birdNodeContext: Working on bird, doesn't look up at player

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Vis medicatrix...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Casts spell (healing word) on the bird.NodeContext: A quietly murmured spell

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: There. It's up to her now. Life or death.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still looking at the birdNodeContext: Still looking at the bird

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Now, what -
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to the playerNodeContext: Friendly, but cuts herself off when she sees you're a race she doesn't like

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Drow. Last time I saw one of you folk, he tried to slit me open. I hope you're more agreeable.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Doesn't like drow, but she's willing to give you a chance.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Where did you see another drow?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: That's neither here nor there.
node_data.context: NodeContext: dismissive

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Look, you obviously want something. What is it?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Now, what was it you needed?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to the playerNodeContext: Turns to player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Healing. Looks like I came to the right person.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: I do what I can. For most folks, that's enough.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Come here. Let's have a look at you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Approaches the player to examine themNodeContext: Approaches the player to examine them

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: You seem healthy enough. A bit tired 'round the eyes, maybe.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examines the player, carefully looking them up and and down.NodeContext: Examines the player, carefully looking them up and and down.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: No good way of putting this. I... uh... have a tadpole in my head.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: A tadpole? A mind flayer tadpole?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Suddenly grave, giving you her full attention. A mind flayer is an incredibly dangerous creature.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Actually, never mind. I'll get help elsewhere.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: No! If you're right...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Urgent 'No!' you can't just let them walk out of here. It's a dangerous situation.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Come, follow me. I might be able to help.
node_data.context: NodeContext: In command, but grave. She's decided she has to kill the player.

AD.speaker: Nettie
AD.text: Halsin would have known what to do. Damn it all.

Bird.speaker: Tingmiaq
Bird.text: To find Halsin. There's not a moment to lose!

AD_TadpoledStart.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledStart.text: We need to be quick. This way.
AD_TadpoledStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing for the player to follower her as she escorts them to the storage room, where they will be quarantined. NodeContext: Concerned

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I wonder what happened to that drow.

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: Is there a dead tadpole in that jar?

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I can't tell if this is a temple or a library.

AD_TadpoledCombat.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledCombat.text: I don't want to hurt you - but I have to protect the others.

AD_WithBird.speaker: Nettie
AD_WithBird.text: They did a number on you, didn't they?
AD_WithBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunched over the bird, moving hands over it.NodeContext: Sadly

AD_WithBird.speaker: Nettie
AD_WithBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunched over the bird, moving hands over it.NodeContext: Gently, as if to a child

WoundedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
WoundedBird.text: Please... I'm resting...

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Something took a chunk out of you. What happened?

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *The bird says nothing, trying to rest.*

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Prod the bird's wing.

WoundedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
WoundedBird.text: Argh!
WoundedBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player prods the bird's injured wing

WoundedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
WoundedBird.text: Big dog - gnoll... I got too close...

WoundedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
WoundedBird.text: Please... I'm resting...

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Something took a chunk out of you. What happened?

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *The bird says nothing, trying to rest.*

WoundedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
WoundedBird.text: Please... I'm resting...

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Something took a chunk out of you. What happened?

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *The bird says nothing, trying to rest.*

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Prod the bird's wing.

WoundedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
WoundedBird.text: Argh!
WoundedBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player prods the bird's injured wing

WoundedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
WoundedBird.text: Big dog - gnoll... I got too close...

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Where did you see these gnolls?

WoundedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
WoundedBird.text: Hills... near road...

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *The bird lapses into silence, her head lolling to the side.*

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Prod her again.

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *She lies limply on the table, completely still.*
WoundedBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player prods the bird. No response.

Cyanide.speaker: Nettie
Cyanide.text: Don't worry about him on the table. I'm not in the habit of killing drow.
Cyanide.context: NodeContext: gesturing to dead drow on the table

PAD_Relieved.speaker: Player
PAD_Relieved.text: I can feel the poison clearing - I'm cured!

HealedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
HealedBird.text: There was so much noise out there. I'm glad you're okay.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: Looks like Halsin's our best bet for a cure.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: We need to find him, before it's too late.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: What if something happened to him?

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: All the more reason to hurry.

LockedUp.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp.text: Yes? Is there anything I can do?

LockedUp.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp.context: NodeContext: A little sadly. She wants to save you, but feels that she morally can't.

LockedUp.speaker: Player
LockedUp.text: We can both see I have no symptoms - I'm not about to change!

LockedUp.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp.text: Same as the drow... But Master Halsin said he'd turn eventually.

LockedUp.speaker: Player
LockedUp.text: You can't do this - your leader needs to talk to me.

session_synopses.PAD_Cyanide: Context: Nettie has given the player a vial of poison to take if they start turning into mind flayers. Players reflect on whether they should actually take it if the time comes.Speaker 1 has just promised Nettie they will take the poison if they begin to turn. (SPEAK TO JORDI, The Speaker 1 nodes may need to be changed. )Speaker 2 reacts to Speaker 1 acquiring the poison after swearing to Nettie they'll use it if they start to turn.Gale - Shadowheart: We'll resort to poison if necessary.Lae'zel - Astarion - Wyll - Karlach: It won't come to that - don't entertain the option.
session_synopses.AD_Busy: Nettie is dealing with a player and has been interrupted by another player.
session_synopses: Nettie is the apprentice of Halsin, the missing druid. We can tell her about the parasite in our heads. She listens with compassion but decides the player is too dangerous and must be quarantined. If she knows about the parasite, she'll invite the player to come with her deeper into her rooms for "treatement."
session_synopses.AD: This triggers as Nettie is at her desk in Halsin's lab, researching and organising. The bird she was treating may have died at this point.
session_synopses.Bird: This bird has been told to go and find Halsin and you're interupting him just as he's getting ready to take flight. He's tense and in a hurry to be gone, so he'll only answer one question before taking to the skies and carrying out his mission.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledStart: Nettie's comments as she walks with the 'infected' player to the storage room, where they will be quarantined.
session_synopses.PAD_SeeDrow: The player broke inside the room without Nettie. Normally they follow her inside and they get the info from her. The VB stops playing when the tadpoled scene with Nettie starts or when Halsin is found in the goblin camp.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledCombat: The player triggered combat during the tadpoled scene
session_synopses.AD_WithBird: Nettie is tending to a badly wounded bird. The bird is weak, its life hangs in the balance, but Nettie is doing what she can.
session_synopses.WoundedBird: Wounded bird is resting on the table after being treated by Nettie. It's probably going to die. If you poke it repeatedly, it will die.
session_synopses.Cyanide: Nettie leads the player into a lab and fetches a thorn. The player doesn't know, but the thorn is a deadly poison. Nettie knows it's the only choice she has - the player could transform into a monster and kill everyone in the camp. She sees this as a kindness - the transformation is terrible - so she has a very 'matter of fact nurse' tone about the whole thing before she scratches you, but will get stressed if you resist. Once she's scratched the player, her tone will be softer - kinder. She plans to sit with you while you pass and make it as easy as possible. The player will have to convince her they're not a threat if they're going to get the antidote. She'll be slow to convince, hesitant to allow any risk to the camp. Nettie is STANDING for this entire dialog.
session_synopses.PAD_Relieved: The player is cured from poison ( the status DEN_APPRENTICE_THORN). This status has 3 stages leading to death. Each time the player make a long rest, they get closer to death.This PAD of relief plays only if the status reached the stages 2 or 3. The status was getting worse and worse, which must have been worrying, but now they've been cured.
session_synopses.HealedBird: The 'Wounded Bird' that Nettie was treating after some time has passed (after Goblin Hunt or Attack on Den). The bird's recovering and feels a bit better.
session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleResearch: Player read Halsin's research on the mind flayer tadpole. The VB plays only if they didn't find Halsin already and didn't go through the tadpoled scene with Nettie (otherwise they got all that information from her so it's not a surprise).
session_synopses.LockedUp: During the scene where she scratches you. Nettie is in the lab, sitting at a table, studiying Halsin's notes. The player can still try to persuade her to give the antidote. The player must also accept to take the wyvern poison. The other choice is to kill Nettie.

AD.speaker: Tracker Worm
AD.text: Minthara's gonna skin us. No one knows about this damn weapon.

AD.speaker: Sharp-Eye Gurza
AD.text: Yeah. She'll kill us dead if we go back without it.

AD.speaker: Warrior Gresh
AD.text: We'll get the druid talking. Grove's got to be full of magic.

AD.speaker: Tracker Torrack
AD.text: That's why I've been stabbin' all the rats. Might be spies.

AD_CapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
AD_CapturedGoblin.text: They ain't as friendly as me. Not as clever either. Kill 'em.
AD_CapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: sly, vicious on last two words

session_synopses.AD: A quartet of goblins scouts are torturing a druid they captured in the tunnels, trying to find out the location of a weapon for the Absolute. They expect the other goblins will be bursting in the front gate of the grove any minute, and are unaware the others were defeated.
session_synopses.AD_CapturedGoblin: Sazza tells players to kill other goblins while she is being rescued from the grove

AD_Flee.text: Blast it all! I'm going home.

VB_HagLeaves.speaker: Player
VB_HagLeaves.text: That old woman was certainly memorable.
VB_HagLeaves.context: NodeContext: Positive but unsure. She was charming but also strange.

session_synopses.AD_Flee: Auntie Ethel has been either attacked or disrupted in some way and runs off home - annoyed.
session_synopses.VB_HagLeaves: VB played when the player sees the Hag leave the Den.

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Did that...? No, damn it. Still nothing.

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Maybe - maybe it just needs time to wear off. Fingers crossed the goblins don't return any time soon.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: You. Saw you fighting those slimy bastards.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowl in hand, paused mid preperation of gruel. Next to a pot with a ladle in hand. Looking at the player, appears annoyed. NodeContext: Gruff sounding. Shouldn't be clear if you're annoyed at the player or not.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds the bowl out to the player. Nods towards it, doesn't expect to be refused. NodeContext: Gruff as you hand the food to the player. Doesn't expect the player to refuse.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: Best to fill your belly now - while we still can.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding the bowl out. NodeContext: Warmth to her voice despite the gruff exterior. She's obviously concerned about the player but is hiding it.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: Suit yourself, but the only way we'll make it to Baldur's Gate is to run, and run hard.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shrug as Okta pulls the bowl back towards her. NodeContext: Player has turned down your food. You're annoyed but hiding it with indifference.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: If a gnoll catches your scent, you'll need every bit of strength. Trust me.

AD_TieflingGuard1.speaker: Rikka
AD_TieflingGuard1.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's staring at the dead below.NodeContext: Shocked and scared.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear lifts up his head, sniffs the air and goes back to sleep.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear sluggishly gets up. (It moves in scripting, after the dialogue has ended.)

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: Glad you made it inside... doubt we'll be safe here for long though.
Gatekeeper.context: NodeContext: twitchy - she's watching the tree-line as she speaks, expecting an attack

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: There'll be more coming. Goblins hunt in packs.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper.text: You could hold off a horde of goblins from this position.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: Maybe - but we're not fighters. If they broke through, it'd be a massacre.
Gatekeeper.context: NodeContext: slightly reassured but still anxious

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: The sooner we leave for Baldur's Gate, the better.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Aradin's back with his tail between his legs. I'm glad for your help, but I'd hoped you were Halsin.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Hells, I didn't mean it that way. Halsin's important, but you're the first bit of good faith we've had since he left.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Keep your wits about you. Things are tense with the druids here.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: Her friend just died unexpectedly.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He was joking about Okta's soup just a moment ago...
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: Her friend just died unexpectedly.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Kaldani
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: Trying to coax Rikka on softly. Rikka is shocked because one of the other guards just died, but they have to bury him and get ready for more goblins. There is no time keep standing around.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: And now what? We dig a hole and be done with him?
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: still trying to come to terms with her friend dying and having to bury him quickly.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Kaldani
AD_CorpseMove.text: We... we could say a prayer. We should have time for that.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: soft, trying to get Rikka to move on and help bury the guard that just died, even if they can't do much.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: Yeah... yeah, that would be good.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: weary, trying to come to terms with everything.

VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.text: *Here lies Zevlor. He saved us when all hope seemed lost. Thank you, friend.*
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

AD_TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_TieflingGuard10.text: Goblins, gnolls... so many ways to die.
AD_TieflingGuard10.context: NodeContext: Morbid jokes about how to die - jovial.

PAD_ShadowheartBook.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBook.text: A temple of Shar? Where? And what's this about a curse?
PAD_ShadowheartBook.context: NodeContext: First she's heard of this temple.

PAD_BearStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_BearStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Forest Father, we are granted balance.*

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: Try it again. I dare you.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: You barged in without an invitation. I wouldn't call that friendly.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: See, you're in my territory. And I want you gone.

Squirrel.speaker: Player
Squirrel.text: Back off, squirrel. Or I'll make you.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: Okay, okay, calm down. We can make a deal.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: How about this - you can stay if you keep those ugly feet on the ground.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: I'll even sweeten the pot. Found some weird smelling stuff on the ground. You can keep it. But...
Squirrel.context: NodeContext: sweet but an edge to your voice at the end. You're about to threaten.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: The trees are mine. Follow the rules, and I won't have to intervene. Got it?

PAD_EntranceStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_EntranceStatue.text: *This grove is kept by Silvanus' faithful.*

GruntingKid_Hideout.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_Hideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: with a nod of greetingNodeContext: abrupt greeting

Refugee4.speaker: Toron
Refugee4.text: We should get moving. Goblins are bound to regroup eventually.
Refugee4.context: NodeContext: Glimmer of hope. Eager to get moving.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.context: NodeContext: Putting on a good front, but slightly afraid. Should still sound confident though.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: My friend's blood not enough? Come to rip me open too?
TieflingGuard11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tiefling raises his weapon half-heartedly.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard11.text: You've seen other githyanki? Tell me where - or I'll have your head.
TieflingGuard11.context: InternalNodeContext: Prior to gith chokepoint, otherwise this info is useless to the player so failing this option might have them reload for nothing

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: Stand back, toad. I owe you nothing!

AD_Adventurer02.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer02.text: Damn this. Damn them. Damn everything.

VB_Grave_Kanon.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_Kanon.text: *Here lies Kanon. He gave his life defending others. He will be missed.*
VB_Grave_Kanon.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

Rat.speaker: Narrator
Rat.text: *The rat's eyes soften as he emits a pained squeak.*

Rat.speaker: Narrator
Rat.text: *You realise the source of his discomfort - one of his front teeth is chipped.*

Rat.speaker: Player
Rat.text: Bare your own teeth at him.

Rat.speaker: Narrator
Rat.text: *The rat bristles with an offended hiss.*

AD_TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TieflingGuard4.context: NodeContext: Sighing, she's walking around and noticing more problems than solutions in the grove that has become a refugee camp for her people

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: Glad you were here for those goblins. Picked one off yesterday, myself. Shot her through the throat.
Tiefling001.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's closed off, crossing one arm over the other to hug herself, uncomfortable with what she did.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: That should've killed her, but... she kept gasping. Clawing at the arrow.
Tiefling001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking away absentmindedly, reliving the bad memories.

Tiefling001.speaker: Player
Tiefling001.text: Your first kill? Don't worry - it gets easier.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: That's what Zevlor said, too. I hope you're right.
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: She's trying to be hopeful, but still has doubts.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: I want to help - I just didn't think it would feel like this.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Used to think the goblins'd kill us the second we set foot outside. But after hearing what you did at the gate...

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: ... well, I still think they'll kill us. But at least we can put up a fight.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10.text: Try not to keel over with the first blade drawn.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Well, we came through Avernus. We might not look it, but we're tough.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Who knows, some of us might even make it to Baldur's Gate.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10.text: Maybe you'll catch a glimpse of Baldur's Gate before they cut you down.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Ohh, well aren't you an optimist?

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: I've seen what the goblins can do to a vulnerable caravan, so I'm not as confident.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: But if you are, why not put a little gold on the line? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: No? Shame, I thought you might enjoy a little fun.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Be safe out there, whatever comes your way.

PAD_WolfStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_WolfStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Treefather, our turmoil is calmed.*

AD_TieflingGuard3.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3.text: What I'd do for some salt...
AD_TieflingGuard3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over cooking pot - cooking. NodeContext: Slightly gruff. Talking to herself.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: Another one. What are you under there, then? Ant? Aurochs?

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: The keepers of this place. They change their form to fit their need.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: They become birds, to hunt on the wing. Bears, to tear flesh with teeth. But for me - only oxen. Only same old hay.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: And I cannot even eat it, because the horned ones hide their shiny bits inside.

Mule1.speaker: Player
Mule1.text: 'Shiny bits'? The tieflings put something in your hay?

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: Hiding things, thinking they are clever. Not clever.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: Sometimes I eat the shiny bits, and they have to go looking for them on the other end.

PAD_ElkStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_ElkStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Old Oak, all death begets life.*

Refugee1.speaker: Eramas
Refugee1.text: Goblins. Druids. This grove is a death trap.

Refugee1.speaker: Eramas
Refugee1.text: Grab what you can and get out, that's my advice.

AD_Refugee4.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee4.text: Can't keep the goblins out forever. This is no fortress, and we're no warriors.

AD_Refugee1.speaker: Eramas
AD_Refugee1.text: Is that everything? I think that's everything...

GraveDig.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig.text: *Freshly turned soil shifts beneath your feet as you approach the grave.*
GraveDig.context: NodeContext: The player has approached the grave of the very recently deceased.

GraveDig.speaker: Player
GraveDig.text: Bow your head and silently pay your respects.

GraveDig.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig.text: *You close your eyes, finding a moment of peace.*
