PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Aradin
PleaAtTheGate.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Barth : From his position on his last shot, he get into his fighting stance
Aradin : From his position on his last shot, he get into his fighting stance
Remira : From her position on her last shot, she get into her fighting stance

AD_WyllCharge.speaker: Wyll
AD_WyllCharge.text: By sickle and sword, strike them down!

Adventurer1.speaker: Barth
Adventurer1.text: Damn coward's got plenty to answer for.
Adventurer1.context: NodeContext: Goblins are defeated, but party isn't behind the gates yet.

AdventurerLeader.speaker: Aradin
AdventurerLeader.text: Out of my way. I'll tear the horns off that bloody coward!
AdventurerLeader.context: NodeContext: Furious at Zevlor, who nearly locked him out of the grove.

Adventurer2.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2.text: Said it from the start. Shouldn't have trusted those foulbloods.
Adventurer2.context: NodeContext: Very nasty. All-but-saying a slur re: tieflings

AD_GoblinCaptain.speaker: Za'krug
AD_GoblinCaptain.text: Scouts - get to the high ground. Raiders - charge the bastards!
AD_GoblinCaptain.context: NodeContext: Shouting commands to his troops as they enter combat

AD_GoblinCaptain.speaker: Za'krug
AD_GoblinCaptain.context: NodeContext: A warcry to his new god, the Absolute

AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened.speaker: Zevlor
AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened.text: The danger has passed - for now. Open the gates.
AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened.context: NodeContext: Calling out from a high pointl

AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.text: Open up or I'll break the bloody thing down!

AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.text: Look - please, just let us in. They're almost on us.
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.context: NodeContext: Still angry but trying to be reasonable.

VB_ApproachingGate.speaker: Player
VB_ApproachingGate.text: We should check it out - but be careful.

AD_Adventurer1AtGate.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer1AtGate.text: Hurry! Please! The goblins are on us!
AD_Adventurer1AtGate.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking up at Zevlor.NodeContext: Panicked and terrified. About to die.

PAD_RaidersDefeated.speaker: Player
PAD_RaidersDefeated.text: Was that an ordinary raid? Seemed a fool's errand.

PAD_RaidersDefeated.speaker: Player
PAD_RaidersDefeated.text: They likely have a camp nearby. I'd expect more raiders eventually.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved.text: He'll feel that in the morning.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved.text: Now that that's settled, we can get to finding a healer.

AD_AdventurerLeaderRant.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderRant.context: NodeContext: If Zevlor is dead, Aradin sees his corpse

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Aradin
AD_LeadersArgue.text: I should've known. Can't trust a devil.

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersArgue.text: Watch your tongue. Before it's too late.

VB_PeacefulResolution.speaker: Player
VB_PeacefulResolution.context: NodeContext: A massive argument has just died down thanks to you. You're relieved and also surprised at how tense it was. Commenting on situation.

VB_PeacefulResolution.speaker: Player
VB_PeacefulResolution.text: Yes. It's a good thing we were here.

session_synopses.AD_Adventurer2AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.PleaAtTheGate: Initial situation dialog. Adventurers are at the gates of the Den, pleading to be let in while tieflings refuse them entry since goblins are on their trail.
session_synopses.AD_WyllCharge: Originally only meant for Wyll's jumping into combat line.
session_synopses.Adventurer1: Robbed adventurer raiding party and Adventurers Qest dialogues (one-liners). Is fallback for Adventurers Quest in the event Adventurer Leader and Adventurer Raider die.
session_synopses.AdventurerLeader: Minor dialogues before and after Aradin/ Zevlor's confrontation insider the camp.
session_synopses.Adventurer2:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. Shes sarcastic and casually racist.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinCaptain: A goblin veteran leading a raid on a druid grove - he's giving orders to his troops
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened: The tiefling leader calls for the doors to be opened with an AD if players are outside of dialog range.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate: Plea from the adventurer leader at the gates - goblins are almost here, he needs Zevlor to open up! Zevlor is being circumspect.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderRant: Rant the tiefling leader says before going off to meet the adventurers after the goblin raid.
session_synopses.VB_ApproachingGate: VB played when the players are approaching the gates of the DEN.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer1AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.PAD_RaidersDefeated: Context: The raiders that were attacking during plea at the gates have been defeated. Characters ponder what next.
session_synopses.PAD_ConfrontationResolved: READ IN FULL, YOU HAVE TO SCROLL DOWN:VB that plays after DEN_RaidingParty_Confrontation. The dialog ends either with peace having been achieved or with one leader being knocked out by either the opposing leader or a player.This VB has a greeting for each outcome, but there really are three main categories: Player punched a leader, the leaders punched each other OR piece was achieved.Requires two speakers.Speaker 1 is the player who was in the Confrontation dialog, and as such may have punched one of the leaders.Speaker 2 is an accompanying character and as such may be opinionated.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerLeaderRant: Complaint the adventurer leader says after the goblins have been dealt with, before returning to the Den after the gates are opened.
session_synopses.AD_LeadersArgue: Argument that loops over itself while the leader await the arrival of the player. They are both furious and high-energy, having just survived the goblin encounter.
session_synopses.VB_PeacefulResolution: VB if everyone survived the confrontation in Raiding Party.

AD_ZorruGuard.speaker: Eramas
AD_ZorruGuard.context: NodeContext: Finding his colleague tiresome for even asking

AD_ZorruGuard.speaker: Zorru
AD_ZorruGuard.text: Just wait 'til you see 'em. Yellow all over. Covered in spots. No noses to speak of.

session_synopses.AD_ZorruGuard: Zorru and another tiefling speak. Zorru mentions the gith are after him - Tilses isn't sure they even exist.

FrescoAlliance.speaker: Narrator
FrescoAlliance.text:
*'In darkest hour, a concord made,
'Twixt harp and wild against the shade.'*

FrescoAlliance.speaker: Narrator
FrescoAlliance.text: *'Harp and wild'? You recall stories of an alliance between druids and the Harpers, but the details are vague.*

VB_BrokenRunes.speaker: Player
VB_BrokenRunes.text: It's broken, but not too badly.

VB_LockedLibrary.speaker: Player
VB_LockedLibrary.text: I can't even see a lock to pick.

FrescoWorking.speaker: Narrator
FrescoWorking.text:
*'The forest rose with claw and tooth
to tear the darkness from its roots.'*

FrescoWorking.speaker: Narrator
FrescoWorking.text: *The mural depicts druid and beast fighting together to drive monsters from their land.*

FrescoWorking.speaker: Narrator
FrescoWorking.text: *It looks like they were victorious. And yet the monsters have returned.*

FrescoVictory.speaker: Narrator
FrescoVictory.text:
*'The towers seized, the battle done,
the moonrise broke the Darkest One.'*

FrescoVictory.speaker: Narrator
FrescoVictory.text: *You recognise the mark of the dark goddess Shar on the broken helmet. This army marched in her name.*

FrescoVictory.speaker: Shadowheart
FrescoVictory.text: So many dead. Sent to the Nightsinger's embrace.

FrescoVictory.speaker: Narrator
FrescoVictory.text: *'Moonrise' must be a reference to Shar's divine sister, Selne.*

VB_ObtainedReward.speaker: Player
VB_ObtainedReward.text: The glaive the druid's notebook mentioned. Its owner thought it was cursed...

session_synopses.FrescoAlliance: In a well-lit cave. Player looks at a fresco depicting two sides agreeing an alliance. Pass a test to realise that one side are the druids of the wild, and the other the Harpers - a secret organisation.
session_synopses.VB_BrokenRunes: Player finds a broken rune amongst some ruins.
session_synopses.VB_LockedLibrary: Player tries to open a stone door, but it's just a blank slab. There's no place for a key.
session_synopses.FrescoWorking: Player is viewing a mural depicting druids and animals driving monsters from the forest.
session_synopses.FrescoVictory: In a well-lit cave. Player looks at a fresco depicting a group of druids standing over a vanquished army. Pass a test to realise that the army was the army of Shar - a Dark Goddess.
session_synopses.VB_ObtainedReward: Player finds a glaive in a locked room. Reading a nearby book you might learn it was taken from the Shadow cursed lands by Halsin, who found it was infused with dark power. (It does have a special power - the glaive deals 1d6 extra necrotic damage to characters UNLESS they're standing in sunlight.)

node_data.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
node_data.text: You ain't clan - you got no business here.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks the player up and down with distaste.NodeContext: Looks the player up and down with distaste.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standing guard. He is seated with the duergar elder most of the time.

session_synopses.AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is taking his turn.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: You're going up there? You've either got iron guts - or one of those Moonlanterns.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: One of Nere's magic lamps. You won't last without one.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: The death-dark's clogged the top-land, clear to Moonrise Towers. Only a Moonlantern dispels it.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Shadows - thick as a duerro's skull. Sucks the breath right out of your lungs.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Go on up, if you fancy. Me? I'd sooner take a swim in the Darklake.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Well I'll be ploughed sideways - we got a welcoming party.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives. Greymon on a boat.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: You shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Greymon. Projected from the boat. Morgha is talking to him from the shore.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Spit it out. Sergeant finally choked on True Soul Nere's prick?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Morghal, from the docking boat.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Drugh no. The Twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, his party and Greymon/Orgarth get off the boat.NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: That's the trouble - he's got the gold on him. Sergeant's arm is falling off with all the gnome slaves she's been beating.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down after line is spoken.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Greymon, looking at player

Checkpoint.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Seen her run with a barrel under her arm. Just a small one, but enough to blow the drow out.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Someone should grab it. Slaves are never gonna manage with pickaxes.

Mutineers.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
Mutineers.text: Can't go chasing 'maybes' - the sergeant's our ticket in.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Would you look at that, Kur. Someone's having a listen.
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar turns and notices player. Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Narrator
Mutineers.text: *A shiver runs through you. Your mind is awash in ancient resentments.*
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a mindmeld but a resonance due to duergar's psionic sensitivity.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: True Soul, no less. What do you think, Kur - should we take Nere's debt off them?
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Player
Mutineers.text: Why would you think I'm a True Soul?

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: The stench - all you Twat-Souls got one. Some of us got a nose for it.

Rothe_03.speaker: Deep Roth
Rothe_03.text: Grey ones make me work soon. Must sleep.
Rothe_03.context: NodeContext: Sighing. She knows there is little time to sleep before their next shift.

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *The two roth moan quietly as lights flash about their heads.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: *The two Roth paw the ground in irritation as lights flash about their heads.*

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *The roth grunt softly at each other. Small lights flash about their heads in quick, erratic patterns.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Small lights flashing above rothe heads

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion.text: Still your body and quietly observe.

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *One of the beasts seems exhausted. His lights flash in slow, methodical beats.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Deep Rothe Calf's lights flash slowly

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *You recognise the spell - Dancing Lights. It is how roth communicate with each other.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lights flicker above both rothe

Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.speaker: Kirgrath
Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.text: Shit. Brithvar's kicked the tankard. Prick was older than dirt.

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: Sschindylryn's shithouse - you see it? Cock-stench had a wriggler in his skull. All the more reason to clear out.

session_synopses.ElevatorWarningGnome: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby gnome  butts in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment.there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.
session_synopses.Mutineers: Two duergar consider how their fellow duergar have fallen for this new cult that showed up. You can inspire in them a mutiny. If you do, they'll join you when you free Nere (UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny).Brithvar is a Mind Master, a duergar with psionic skills. He wears a strange mask.
session_synopses.Rothe_03: The rothe is trying to sleep while her fellow rothe talk. She is tried from a long day's work and knows there is little time to sleep before her next shift.
session_synopses.RotheDiscussion: This occurs between two Rothe. The first is a younger Rothe who desires  freedom and a life without pain. The other Rothe is older and more stern. He has worked since the times of Ketheric.Player can speak with them or listen in on their conversation with an animal handling check.
session_synopses.Mutineers_GroupFollowUp: The mutinous duergar is dead, so another takes his place to tells you they are moving on
session_synopses.Mutineers_FollowUp: The mutinous duergar tells the player what comes next for them: an assault on Moonrise Towers.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: So those mushrooms can raise the dead? That's... interesting.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Handy magic, that. Maybe it'll be of use to us.

session_synopses.PAD: Players can find a few NPCs that have been raised by the myconoid to work as their servants. The party comments on this through a VB.This can fire on any character, and since it is not a result of direct player actions, the replies can be fairly opinionated.Can take one or two speakers.

SurvivalCheck_PAD.speaker: Player
SurvivalCheck_PAD.text: Bloodied tracks - quite small, too. A gnome found some trouble here.

session_synopses.SurvivalCheck_PAD: The player identifies Thulla's tracks to be that of an escaping gnome if they pass a survival check

NereHeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
NereHeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Nere's dead body.

NereHeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
NereHeadLoot.text: *The head breaks off cleanly from the drow's body.*
NereHeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Show player's face as they finish decapitation, stow knife. Raise head to inspect it.

session_synopses.NereHeadLoot: After the drow Nere dies, the players have the option to cut off his head if they are on a Myconid Revenge quest. If they fail the Strength check, the player makes a mess of it and the party gets splattered.

node_data.speaker: Alchemist Argram
node_data.text: You tryin' to tip us over? Stop moving, idiot.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spitting in between words, enraged

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: I offer to parley, and he brings a spectator? Twit. Quite ruined my ambush.

Wizard.speaker: Player
Wizard.text: I'm more concerned with this 'twit' who set a spectator on you.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: Pah. A rival - a mere footnote to my legend. You should be more concerned with who I am.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: I am Dhourn. Third son of House Ba'Tol, first rank evoker, and initiate of Gravenhollow's...
Wizard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)NodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: ... my crystal. My memory shard. Where is it?
Wizard.context: NodeContext: Rising panic as he can't find an item we stole from him.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: You think it clever to steal from a statue, do you?
Wizard.context: NodeContext: To us, with suspicion and fury

session_synopses.CINE_SpectatorReveal: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. A spectator rises from a chasm.
session_synopses.Wizard: Drow Wizard that has some info about the Adamantine Furnace.Paranoid after being petrified by the spectator.narrative feature: Used to kill his oponents and interrogate them afterwards (Disguise Self + Speak With Dead).

node_data.speaker: Mossy Myconid
node_data.text: ((*no peace*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speaks with hivemind/mysterious voice.

AD_NoAnswerFromGod.speaker: Narrator
AD_NoAnswerFromGod.text: *There is no answer from the presence.*

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Our blood to fill your oceans, oh blessed BOOOAL! Our bones to build your temple in the deep!
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: NodeContext: Fanatic devotion, speaking to the air/altar

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *A wave of pure devotion washes over you - and with every surge, you feel a presence grow in response.*

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: WORDS, PRIEST. PROMISES. YOUR GOD WANTS PROOF. WANTS BLOOD.
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his god form. He should be invisible with some VFXNodeContext: DISMISSIVE, IMPATIENT

SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: True

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *These beings are kuo-toa - former mind flayer slaves that manifest their gods through sheer belief.*
CinematicNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the playerNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the playerNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the player

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: YOU! Our Lord of Murder demands sacrifice! You will be an offering for the great god BOOOAL!

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Bhaal is the true Lord of Murder. Perhaps I should offer you instead.

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Bhaal...? No... we are... we are faithful to Lord BOOOAL...

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *You sense a flicker of doubt - brief, but enough. For an instant, the godly presence falters.*

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: NO! NO! Stop that!
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in the process of reverting back to his common form. He is invisible for "NO! NO" and becomes visible for "Stop that!"NodeContext: Furious, panicked - his con is being exposed and he's losing power even as he speaks

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: He's a fabrication. Whatever you created him for, you don't need him.
True

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: ARGH! NO! SHUT IT! Shut your rotten mouth!
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in the process of reverting back into his common form. He is invisible for the capitalised parts of this now, but then becomes visible for "Shut your rotten mouth"NodeContext: The lack of faith is literally draining power from him - sulky and furious all in one as he returns to his common form

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *You feel the presence waver - one moment a god of awesome power, the next... a common redcap.*

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Ah. Bollocks.
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his common form. He is no longer invisible, and he appears as a redacapNodeContext: Realising the game is up

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Don't do anything hasty, now. The fishfolk got plenty of power - we can share.
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his common form. He is no longer invisible, and appears as a common redcapNodeContext: Still annoyed with us but willing to make a deal. Only SLIGHTLY wheedling - redcaps aren't known for negotiating

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: ... blessed Boooal... what...?

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Shut it, you!  I'm talking to... my Chosen! Chosen got power - you want power, don't ya?
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his common form. He is no longer invisible, and just appears as an ordinary redcapNodeContext: Shouting his high priest down - he wants to seal the deal with us before his idiot followers fully catch on

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: I won't let you enslave them any longer.

HighPriest.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
HighPriest.text: You've slain the pretender! We knew in our hearts the god BOOOAL was false.
HighPriest.context: NodeContext: In awe of you, rushing to affirm his faith - and absolutely means it

HighPriest.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
HighPriest.text: But you - we see you. We know you by your true name... MAHKLOOMPAH!
HighPriest.context: NodeContext: Kuo-Toa give overwrought, nonsensical names to their gods. Air of great ceremony as he bestows one on you

session_synopses.AD_NoAnswerFromGod: The player has clicked an altar from which a godly presence spoke previously.
session_synopses.SpeakWithBOOOAL: The player encounters a group of kuo-toa, humanoid fish beings capable of creating gods just by imagining them. They're overzealous and easily duped, and are currently worshipping a murderous redcap they've mistaken for a god of murder. He's capitalising on the situation and very much enjoying the incredible power with which he's been invested. In this dialogue, we can deal with him as this great inscrutable power, or see through the situation and expose / do a deal with him. In all cases he's brash, offensive and generally gross.The all cap lines are BOOOAL in his fully powerful form.When we suddenly rever to lower caps, it's when we've forced him into his 'common' form.BOOOAL = Boo-AHHL (almost guttural)Kuo-Toa = Koo-oh-TO-ah
session_synopses.KuoToaMinion: A  node that plays when the player tries to click on a praying kuotoa. They will either praise you as the Chosen of their madeup god, or make you a new made-up god.BOOOAL - Booh-ALMahkloompah - mak-LOOM-pah
session_synopses.AD_FishChanting: Fanatical chanting at the altar of a murder god, a crowd heard from afar rather than direct dialogue. This dialog has no lines that are spoken by the character - the lines are intended to be subtitles for the SFX
session_synopses.HighPriest: The Zealot is a Kuo Toa obsessed with his new god - you. You've slain the 'pretender' he was just as dedicated to only moments before, and he's transferred all that zealotry to you.Mahkloompah = ma-KLOOM-pa.

LootingCorpse.speaker: Narrator
LootingCorpse.text: *Deep gnomes - killed under the yoke of slavers.*
LootingCorpse.context: CinematicNodeContext: Panning over small field of dead bodies.

LootingCorpse.speaker: Player
LootingCorpse.text: I will take the lives of those who took yours.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: Where's your pickaxe, gnome? Thrinn know you're over here?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spits on the groundNodeContext: Said like a threat.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Player
CorpseDisposers.text: She asked me to inspect the bodies for anything useful.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: You know - I don't think she did. I think you're trying to escape. We aren't gonna let that happen, are we, Viss?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: NodeContext: Said matter-of-factly and threateningly, about to start combat.

session_synopses.LootingCorpse: Player having a contemplative moment while observing the corpses of dead gnomes.
session_synopses.CorpseDisposers: Two grouchy duergar, one a talker and one who somewhat mimics/ repeats what his partner says, are responsible for dumping dead gnome bodies into the lake. You can convince them to let you loot the bodies.

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: Be welcome in this house. I wait for your commands.
Automaton.context: NodeContext: The robot talks to a new person he hasn't talked to before while in peace mode. He bows.

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: Command as you see fit, my lord, my liege.

Automaton.speaker: Gale
Automaton.text: Don't get me wrong. I love poetry as much as the next wizard, but using it to command an automaton... seems a bit self-indulgent to me.
Automaton.context: NodeContext: Annoyed he didn't think of it

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: An unbeknownst command that I cannot fulfil.

AD_GalePowerRestored.speaker: Gale
AD_GalePowerRestored.text: Ingenious use of the magic in the tower's floral core. Though not ingenius enough to outsmart Gale of Waterdeep.
AD_GalePowerRestored.context: NodeContext: His hypothesis proved correct. Respecting the ingenuity, but smug that he/the party was able to disable it

session_synopses.Automaton: This is an old robot guarding the top of a deserting tower. His master programmed him to speak in verse. He talks mostly in iambic pentameter (though sometimes in iambic hexameter) - think shakespearian verse.Translator node: this dialogue is linked to other poems in the game, and uses the same words. For more information, please read the 'Riddles and word puzzles of note' doc!
session_synopses.AD_GalePowerRestored: The Arcane Tower has been powered again.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: He hid from the Hells' forces - but they still got to him.

session_synopses.PAD: Players find the journal in the Panic Room after identifying the Merregon Masks. This belonged to a Dark Justiciar who hid from the orthon when it rampaged, and was trapped when rubble fell.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Shit. You did it.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: What now?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Take the lift to the surface.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Shit - up there? Forget it. I hear the land's cursed clear to Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Grymforge is even more dangerous. Stay at your own peril.
False

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Down here I know what I'm dealing with. Up there, not so much. Got a better idea?

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: What now?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Take the lift to the surface.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Shit - up there? Forget it. I hear the land's cursed clear to Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: What now?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Take the lift to the surface.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Shit - up there? Forget it. I hear the land's cursed clear to Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: The curse is cleared. You'll be perfectly safe.
False

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Cleared - just like that, huh? Well I'm not taking the chance. Any other ideas?

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: What now?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Figure it out yourself.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Damn it - just when I thought you half decent.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: I know a place, cross the lake. Should be safe.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: You might be a shithead. But I'm grateful.

session_synopses: Skickpit has a foul mouth to match the duergar. He runs their errands for them and brings them drinks. You can ask if he wants freed, attack him, or leave him be.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Thought we'd leapt from frying pan to flame for a moment, there.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Fah. Thought I'd have to breathe my last in Nere's stink.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful. Breathless.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: I'm grateful, don't mistake me, but... why help us? You're one of them, aren't you?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Guarded, sizing the player up - he thinks we're one of the cultists

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: The cult thinks it owns me. I beg to differ.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: That didn't much look like begging. But no complaints from me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Referencing the player's recent slaughter of his captors

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: You did just lift a mountain from our heads, so... good enough for me, I reckon.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nodding, accepting - not going to look a gift horse in the mouth

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Here - the Ironhand Gnomes honour their debts. With Wulbren gone, that falls to me.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard 'handing reward' animation.NodeContext: Drawing himself up to perform a necessary obligation - doesn't see himself as leadership material but accepts the responsibility

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Make it quick! We need to find Wulbren - now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Who's Wulbren?

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: The leader of our expedition. He was sent off to Moonrise Towers.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: We were just slave-hands to the cult, but not Wulbren. He... knows things. Things they want to know too.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hesitant to say exactly what Wulbren knows

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: What has he gotten himself mixed up in now...

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Before you ask, no - I'm not going to stage a rescue.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Aye. Nor us, I'm afraid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: shrugging, a little defeated. This line trails off into another 'Much as I want to march after Wulbren myself... we can't.'

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: We have our own freedom to look to, I'm afraid. We'll take our chance when it arises, then back to the city.
node_data.context: NodeContext: His people are still enslaved - he needs to be pragmatic.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Wulbren knew the risks when he came in search of runepowder. We all did.

session_synopses: The gnome leader's main dialogue. He thanks you for saving them, and tells you what brought his people to the Underdark to begin with - an expedition led by their charismatic leader Wulbren, to find a forgotten gnomish explosive of awesome power - runepowder.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Seems the 'shrooms are letting in more people every day.
DwarvenAlchemist.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You see a fella on his own on your way in? Dwarf. Baelen's his name.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Knock yourself out. But don't come begging for coin if you find him.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: If you try to ransom him to me, you'll find yourself skint and stuck with a fat old lout.

AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.speaker: Restless Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.text: ((*the disease still festers. I will cut it out*))

CheckpointGuard_001.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_001.text: *The creature's song rumbles within you, neither warm nor welcoming.*

VB_GlutDead_1P.speaker: Player
VB_GlutDead_1P.text: The usurper is dead. So much for 'Circle Glut'.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

DeepRothe.speaker: Deep Roth
DeepRothe.text: Master sounds different, like old self. Angry self. Don't like.
DeepRothe.context: NodeContext: SWA line. Reproachful. A simple beast of burden senses his master has returned to a crueler demeanour.

AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.speaker: Noxious Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.text: ((*you will fall. and in death, we will raise you*))

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.text: I must complete this study. Entertain yourself elsewhere.

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*the tumour is excised. the duergar are dead*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*here, I break ground. from the dark will a mighty Circle rise. my song will fill the Grotto!*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*death-doer - the Grotto may sustain but one Sovereign. in the Age of Glut...*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*...there may be no Spaw. eliminate the other Sovereign*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign.text: If you're so eager for blood, Glut, then let me give it to you.

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the servant's face and body. Through music and vision, the sovereign reveals its origins.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *You see a frothing duergar, axe drawn, crazed by bloodlust, bearing down on a young myconid.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *The frightened myconid circle conjures mildewed vines. They encircle and transform the duergar.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *It now belongs to the circle. It will obey the sovereign.*

AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.text: ((*the sickness can't be left to fester*))

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Narrator
RapportSpores_Alone.text: *Your mind is a canyon, and the words echo from every crevasse.*

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone.text: I don't know who you are, but you're not welcome in my head.

AD_Myconid_005_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_Myconid_005_Combat.text: ((*cut the blight away. watch it wither*))

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: *The corpse twitches in response to the spell...*

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Player
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: What was your role in the circle?

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: *Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Dead Myconid Sprout
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: ((*...to grow. to know. to be one with the Circle...*))

MushroomField_Warning.speaker: Restless Myconid
MushroomField_Warning.text: ((*after the light comes the bang. step away. step away*))

session_synopses.DwarvenAlchemist:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_001: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.VB_GlutDead_1P: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_000: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence telepathically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.DeepRothe: A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.ServantHookHorror_01: You interact with a hook horror servant belonging to the myconids.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly.

 The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it.

The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars.

 Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign
. 
Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. 

This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace.

 As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_004: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.ServantDuergar1: Player tries speaking with an enthralled duergar. Duergar players get an option to go hostile afterwards.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.RapportSpores_Alone:
Non has met: Triggers if the player is alone when first hearing the myconid circle's collective voice.

Hasmet: Occurs second time, regardless of how mnay players are in party. Player hears a strange voice, and has a reaction to it. Second time: Tries to respond to it.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_005_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.DeadMyconid_Dead: Speak with dead on Myconid sprout. Sprouts are children. This one should sound young. It describes being killed by grey dwarves (duergar). Should not sound like hivemind.
session_synopses.MushroomField_Warning: Myconid warns you that mushrooms explode if you get too close.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_002: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence teleapthically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.DirectToSovereign: If you speak to a myconid after the guards speak to you but you have not yet spoken to the sovereign, his voice will speak through them.

PAD_Reaction.speaker: Player
PAD_Reaction.context: NodeContext: Facing off against a large monster that's just burst out of the ground. Said with focus and determination, rather than fear.

session_synopses.PAD_Reaction: The bulette appears for a second time in the Underdark and is going to attack the players. Said with focus and determination rather than fear.

session_synopses.02: A duergar guard, posted above the docks, watching the lake.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A slender drow blade impales the stone before you, keeping a silent vigil.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise your goddess' rite - a warrior's sacrifice. Only blood, freely given, will honour the fallen.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: This feels holy. Consider what the appropriate ritual might be.
False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You can't recall anything this esoteric. There are too many rituals about swords to count.*

session_synopses: Player discovers an improvised shrine to a dead drow warrior. There's a helmet resting on a sword that's been rammed into a stone. You can take the helmet, but you'll need to think of another way to get the sword free.

Leader.speaker: Brathwen
Leader.text: Hey! Get back with the others. Now.

session_synopses.Leader: Short dialogues when i'm done doing the main 'looting' scene with this character.

PAD_RefuseNobleStalk.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_RefuseNobleStalk.text: Hardly the time for a repast. Later, maybe...
PAD_RefuseNobleStalk.context: NodeContext: Spoken to self. Lightly chastising herself for attempting to eat a mushroom at an inopportune moment.

session_synopses.PAD_RefuseNobleStalk: Shadowheart states that she doesn't want to eat the Noblestalk or is not ready for it yet.

node_data.speaker: Restless Myconid
node_data.text: ((*cleanse the Rot*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: *A faint voice echoes in your mind.*
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld: Nere is calling out to player from a distance

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: I sense you, True Soul... come to me, come to Nere... the poison spreads.
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: NodeContext: Voice goes in and out, as if the connection is weak

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the duergar corpsesInternalNodeContext: Note: speaking of the duergar

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: You don't deserve the death you got. I should have made it last.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the duergar corpses

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: As for the rest of you slave-worms - you've caused enough trouble.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere rears back to cast a spell at the remaining gnomes

FollowUp.text: CinematicNodeContext: Nere fires the spell and the gnomes are dead.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere fires the spell and the gnomes are dead.

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: This was meant to be a simple operation - I arrive, those pack animals clear the debris, and I walk into the temple.

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: Instead, I've been beset by incompetence, treachery, and now this. The Absolute's business remains unfinished.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: On 'this' he gestures to the broken bridge in front of him.

FollowUp.speaker: Player
FollowUp.text: And what business is that, exactly?

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: Important business. My orders come from General Thorm himself.

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: I need you to deliver a message to him. Tell the General that I did what I could, but that the route through Grymforge is impassable.

FollowUp.speaker: Player
FollowUp.text: The General? Is he a favourite of the Absolute?

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: The favourite. Nothing is done in these lands without his knowledge.

session_synopses.Mindmeld_LeavingRegion: When trying to leave Grymforge before freeing Nere, you get a mindmeld from Nere, warning that he will die if you leave. Nere is not physically present in scene - only his voice is heard.
session_synopses.FollowUp: After fighting and killing a group of duergar servants that mutinied against him, Nere takes his rage and frustration out on one of their bodies by kicking it. Once he's done, he takes the players to a nearby broken bridge and explains that he needs reinforcements. The player can promise they'll inform his boss - Chosen Ketheric - or not.

DuergarBoatAtCamp.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: *The boat floats in the murky waters.*
DuergarBoatAtCamp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat floating in the water

DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be a few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.NodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the Grymforge dock with the party on board.
DuergarBoatAtCamp.context: InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be a few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.NodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the Grymforge dock with the party on board.

session_synopses.CINE_RaftApproaching: We see a raft with duergar approaching our raft.
session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCamp: Dialogue when clciking boat in Grymforge to reach the other side of the lake. Player can cross or stay.

03.speaker: Thudd
03.text: Good riddance. Hoon caused nothing but trouble.

session_synopses.03: Pissed off duergar raider who is standing guard while the gnomes are digging up a collapsed tunnel. He is cursing his superior, saying they should just let him suffocate. The player can make use of this and threathen the duergar, saying they will tell the sergeant unless the duergar gives them money.

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: Thou hast come. Hee. Hee. Hee-HEE!

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *The amulet is heavy, but holds a subtle warmth, like it was left under the sun.*

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *Suddenly, the metal surges with heat. You feel great power and an overwhelming urge - to laugh.*

EquipAmulet.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet.text: Grit your teeth. Summon your god's wrath.

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *You know a fury more beautiful, more devastating than any. It wraps you in a comforting embrace.*
Thou hast done well. For what is a laugh, if not one step toward madness?
Hee. Hee. Hee hee hee hee hee hee. Thou art the one!
Return me, take me home - and thou shalt glow with blessings!

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *Etched on its face is an image of the dawning sun.*

session_synopses.EquipAmulet: When the player picks up the Monk's Amulet the monk's astral self appears and will start talking with the player. The player can find out who the monk is, what the amulet does. Later, they find that wearing the amulet will slowly drive them mad as they wear it (the monk has no control over this).

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: There's more back there. Get them out, please!

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Get Beldron out of there. Please.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I've got explosive powder. That should open the way.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Incredible news. Drop it near the cave-in and set it alight!

session_synopses: One-liner dialog in Ketheric City for a gnome working on the cave-in.

AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Gekh Coal
AD_CombatTurn.text: I am pain, I am torment, I am death.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: You're not sun-scum. You should know not to make that much noise.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A low growl.

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His gnarled fist grips an axe.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand doesn't need to have attention drawn to it.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His fist grips an axe. On his gnarled, grey skin, you see the Absolute's brand.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand visible if possible (or just leave it to the narrator)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Stand down. I am a True Soul.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: ... that's right. You are a True Soul.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Weapon lowered a littleNodeContext: Weapon lowered a little

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Not like me to overlook one of the Absolute's Chosen. Let myself get distracted...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks in the direction of this quarry - the myconid circle/injured gnome - with contemplation

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Won't happen again.
node_data.context: NodeContext: The closest thing to an apology that Gekh can manage.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Anyway. The hunt's not over yet.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Turn to leave.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Thought you were here to help.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A little confused.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Brief me, then.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Tracking a runaway slave - deep gnome. Stole boots from my sergeant.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: I'm to kill the runaway - but she's holed up with myconids.
node_data.context: NodeContext: My-con-ids. Spits out the word with some venom - we'll soon learn the myconids killed some of his squad.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Can't get past those rotflowers. They get in your head, make you see things. Half my squad jumped off a cliff, laughing.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Referring to psychic attacks by sentient mushrooms. Not the sort of fight he's used to.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll help you.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Good. Can't let some runt make fools o' the Absolute's warriors.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Bet a True Soul can make those mushrooms choke on their spores.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: I'll keep watch here. Gnome might make a run for it.

Squad_Sniper.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Sniper.text: You'll want to speak with Gekh.

Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.text: Die, so your carcass can rise!

Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.text: I will split your corpse and roast the pieces!

DeadDuergar_Dead.speaker: Shattered Duergar
DeadDuergar_Dead.text: Hunter... reaver... warrior of... the Absolute...

session_synopses: A duergar scout sent by his superior to track down an escaped deep gnome slave and retrieve the valuable Boots of Speed that she stole from the scout's superior. His progress has been hampered as the escapee his hiding amongst some myconids - fungal creatures with telepathic powers. He confronts the player, who may convince him they aren't a threat. They may be able to assist him agains the runaway and myconids, or could betray him, In general, Gekh is a gruff, vicious type. If the player convinces him that they're his superior (a true soul, for instance) he'll show a little more deference.
session_synopses.Squad_Sniper: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.
session_synopses.DeadDuergar_Dead: The corpse of a duergar follower of the Absolute, who was part of a group sent to hunt down an escaped deep gnome slave in the Underdark. This duergar died after encountering some myconids - sentient fungal creatures with telepathic powers.

002.speaker: Ward Pistle
002.text: You don't need nothing I've got.

session_synopses.002: Surly female duergar, lazy and trying to live the good life using her gnome slave. This dialogue occurs after she and her companion have ordered the duergar around.

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Kettel
node_data.text: One step closer an' you're fish food.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Dunnol
node_data.text: Get yourself set before that powder goes boom.

01.speaker: Player
01.text: Where did the drow come from?

01.speaker: Murmath
01.text: Caught 'em sniffin' around. Easy marks - had the stench of the top-lands.

session_synopses.01: Drow hang from the bridge. PAD as we see them - Duergar rarely stand up to drow so boldly.One duergar is here, patrolling with a crossbow. He tells us hes keeping watch over the lake - these drow were trying to infiltrate the settlement, and more may come.

session_synopses.CINE_FromPLA: Cinematic Cutscene with the character using an elevator to get from the Zhentarim Hideout to the Underdark

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Derryth Bonecloak, a dwarven alchemist from Baldur's Gate who came to the Underdark along with her husband, Baelen, in search of a rare and valuable mushroom - the noblestalk.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The wall is riddled with holes. A suffocating stench of long-rotten meat wafts out.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: camera on holes in cavern wall

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Inspect the holes.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise the odour - the foul scent of carrion crawlers, centipede-like aberrations that feast on the dead.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: player inspecting holes

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *At one time, these caverns must have been their banquet hall. The creatures are either long gone, or waiting patiently in the darkness.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: player inspecting holes

session_synopses: The player encounters a wall riddled with small holes. A successful Survival check reveals that they were created by carrion crawlers. Small characters can reach in for loot.[Editor's note: try to think of some alternate ways of getting to the loot that don't involve choosing a gnome or halflng at the start of the game.][Scripter comment: we have spell Enlarge/Reduce planned, but I've also added Mage Hand support. Thanks!]

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Angry trills and tremors shake your skull - cries of anguish to its mycelic god.*

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

FourWay.speaker: Lur Xanta
FourWay.text: I speak true, brothers! You know it in your hearts! You know it in your very souls!

FourWay.speaker: Lur Jox
FourWay.text: We need no 'Lolth' - no spider queen! Father Murmath is the head of clan Lur. He hatched us, raised us, feeds us!

FourWay.speaker: Lur Xanta
FourWay.text: What care we for his business here? He keeps us small. Keeps us contained. We should be with the Spider Queen - revered, adored!

FourWay.speaker: Player
FourWay.text: Your sister speaks true. The Spider Queen would welcome you with great enthusiasm.

FourWay.speaker: Lur Xanta
FourWay.text: You! Please - explain to my brothers - we must be among our own kind!

FourWay.speaker: Narrator
FourWay.text: *These spiders are loyal to the local duergar. In the event of a fight, they will join the fray against you - with slavering enthusiasm.*

FourWay.speaker: Player
FourWay.text: Among the Spider Queen's followers, you'd be revered as her physical manifestation. Honoured. Exalted.

FourWay.speaker: Lur Jox
FourWay.text: We owe Father Murmath all we are - and we will never betray him!

FourWay.speaker: Lur Xanta
FourWay.text: But - but the Spider Queen! Lolth! Our due!

session_synopses.FourWay: In this dialogue, Lur Xanta is trying to convince the other 3 to leave with her to join the cult of Lolth.Player can help her convince them, or fail to do so and they will attack Lur Xanta for being disloyal.This dialogue has 2 outcomes:AGGRO: Lur Jox (or another spider) attacks Lur Xanta, killing her in one shot. (via gameplay - not cine)PEACEFUL: Lur Xanta convinces the other 3 to follow her into the Underdark-- they are leaving to somewhere new.Lur Xanta is fantatical and somewhat learned. The other 3 are a bit more simple.
session_synopses.Spider03: Followup with spiders after they kill their sister Xanta.

PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.speaker: Player
PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.text: Must be in one of these chests.

session_synopses.PAD_KnowStashIsHidden: Note: this PAD follows directly from either RecogniseStashLocation or FoundRune. See Kevin V. with any questions, I know it is a bit weird.--------When the player recognises that the Harper rune in Ketheric City is marking a hidden stash, they make an Investigation check. On success, they realise that the Harpers would be smart enough not to leave their stash in plain sight - the goal of this hint is to deter the player from interacting with the mimics in the area and to instead look around for a hidden stash somewhere

session_synopses: The duergar sergeant responsible for the camp while Nere is trapped. She's yelling at the gnomes and is considerably pissed off. After realising you are a True Soul, she asks you to help free Nere from the cave-in, and you can refuse or accept. You might turn in her missing boots if you have found them You can also ask about the gnome that escaped and the scrying eye.

session_synopses.AdamantineGolemSpawn: After a party member opens the valve that pours lava out of on the forging platform, a golem climbs out of the pipes, attacking them.Note: The valve can be activated by (ranged) attacks and spells, so party member positioning is not guaranteed.Note 2: Party members who are not players can activate the valve.

session_synopses.Dead: Dead drow who tried to climb to the secret fairy rings near the Hag's lair. He was using his backpack to check the the ledges (mushrooms) that he was using to climb, but the platforms have a weight limit, which lead to his demise.

She is suspicious of Absolutists, but happy to take their coin. She should be gruff, and absolutely not listless. She tells you that Nere is trapped above.

session_synopses: Baelan, a mushroom hunter,  is surrounded by dangeous Bibberbang mushrooms. He was trying to get to the Noblestalk mushroom, but one of the stone ledges collapsed underneath him and he fell down. His partner Derryth (Dwarven Alchemist) is in the Myconid Village. Important: Baelan seems to have trouble keeping his train of thought - he loses track of his responses, changes the subject and generally seems out of sorts at times. Later, it will be confirmed that he's been suffering from a dementia-like condition for some years now.
session_synopses.Dead: Baelen was out hunting Noblestalk when he was trapped in a field of explosive mushrooms. He's now dead - most likely because the player triggered those mushrooms to explode. He speaks in short, cryptic fragments from beyond the grave.

session_synopses.Rothe_001: Animal dialogue - a skittish beast of burden.A deep rothe that's being used by some duergar to clear rubble - only it smells death and is unwilling to work. The player can try to calm the beast (through Speak with Animals or Animal Handling) and encourage it to calm down and return to work, or to turn against the duergar. If the player fails to calm the rothe, it will turn on both them and the duergar.
session_synopses.Rothe_002: Panicky and bestial. A one-liner deep rothe speak with animals dialogue. It's being used by duergar to clear rocks, only it and another rothe have been unsettled by strange noises and stopped responding to their masters. It can be calmed so it can return to its work (the act of calming occurs when speaking to the othe rothe, whom this one takes its cues from).
session_synopses.Guard_003: A coarse and unempathetic duergar, one of three guarding some Deep Rothe (beasts of burden currently being used to clear rubble).Different reactions if:- animals are panicking;- animals are calm;- animals are dead (doesn't matter how);
session_synopses.RotheDeadAttack: Duergar attack you after you have angered and killed the rothe.
session_synopses.Guard_001_Dead: SwD with the Taskmaster in the Fearful Rothe situation. He might tell you about an ancient forge lying further inside Grymforge.

session_synopses.LastCub: In SwA, this cub speaks in short bursts - he sounds staccato, vicious.The player has killed an owlbear - a large, predatory wild animal. The owlbear's cub remains however, and lingers by his dead mother. The player can decide whether to put the cub out of its misery, or else leave it. If the player has the speak with animals skill, they get some additional insight into the cub's anxiety. If the player lets the cub live, it will proceed to eat its mother - it's still a wild animal, after all.
session_synopses: In SwA, the owlbear speaks like a human. Her voice is deep and threatening - the voice of a seasoned fighter, at home in a fight and used to winning. However, she knows she's injured and at a disadvantage, but refuses to betray that to the player. Doing so might encourage the player to attack, putting her cub in danger.The player stumbles upon the nest of an owlbear; a large, predatory hybrid creature. They find themselves in a stand-off against the beast - if they get too close or act aggressively, it attacks. If they keep cool and back off when the opportunity presents itself, the owlbear will let them leave. The player may also notice that the owlbear is wounded - a broken spear protrudes from one eye socket. They may notice that the owlbear has a cub - this is the main reason for her aggression and territoriality.Additional note 1: the player may stumble upon this scenario by themselves, or they may have been pointed in the right direction after meeting some cultists who had a close encounter with the owlbear. If we won these cultists over, they may be available to fight the owlbear at our side.Additional note 2: If the owlbear mother is killed but her cub survives, we can decide the juvenile's fate. If we spare it, we may later find it being used for sport by the goblins in their camp.
session_synopses.AD_HatchedEgg: The party reacts to coming across some large empty eggshells, from an owlbear. They may recognise the species, or may have already picked up an intact egg.
session_synopses.VB_CubResolution_1P: The players comment briefly on their decision to let an orphaned owlbear cub live or not.
session_synopses.CMB_Enrage: In SwA, the owlbear speaks like a human. Her voice is deep and threatening - in this dialogue specifically, she is enraged.Players encounter an owlbear mother and her cub in a cave. This dialogue plays if players smash her egg or kill her cub in front of her.

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_003.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_003.text: The worms'll feast on your sorry carcass when I'm done with you!

AD_DoorMarks.speaker: Narrator
AD_DoorMarks.text: *Names and heights have been carved into the wood over the years. The last two read 'Maggie Terrens' and 'Marcus Terrens'. Twins, perhaps.*

session_synopses.AD_DoorMarks: Markings on a door frame in an abandoned schoolhouse showing chidlren's growth over the years.

AD_AtCaveEntrance.speaker: Andrick
AD_AtCaveEntrance.text: Bloody Ed. I wish he'd listened.

session_synopses.AD_AtCaveEntrance: Two junior members of a cult have been sent to hunt the wild creature that killed their superior. They've found its nest, but are reluctant to proceed inside and face the beast.
session_synopses.AD_OwlbearCubResolution: Two cult novices, believing you to be their superior, react to your decsion to spare a wild anima.

PatrollingGoblin.speaker: Goblin Brawler
PatrollingGoblin.text: Mind the ogres, your drowsiness. They don't got no respect.

CheckpointGuardsWarning.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
CheckpointGuardsWarning.context: NodeContext: We caught him idling at the entrance of a checkpoint. Not trying very hard with the lie.

AD_StartedCombat.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_StartedCombat.text: You must got a death wish, sneakin' around in my town.

session_synopses.PatrollingGoblin: A goblin is patrolling around the abandoned village on the lookout for intruders. He doesn't want to be bothered.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuardsWarning: Backup guard protecting the entrance to a village the goblins have seized

session_synopses.PAD_PlayerHeardEttercapWarning: The player has touched a spider web and heard an ettercap scream in response. They realise the ettercap has found out they are there.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A feast fit for an ogre. You notice a peculiar dagger protruding from the tough, leathery meat.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The dagger still juts from the meat.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Grasp the handle and pull the dagger with all your might.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You yank the dagger free, leaving a narrow slit behind.*

session_synopses: Near a forest village, there are remains of an ogre campfire and meat spit over it. There's a cool dagger stuck in the meat. The player can attempt to retrieve it in a few ways (2 are listed here, but feel free to add another branch).

PAD_NotReturning.speaker: Player
PAD_NotReturning.text: You can't summon a dead ogre, it turns out.

session_synopses.PAD_NotReturning: Player Blows ogre horn, but no one comes.

VB_ReadLedger.speaker: Player
VB_ReadLedger.text: It says there's a cellar here somewhere.

VB_Trap.speaker: Player
VB_Trap.context: NodeContext: A relieved observation. An automated booby trap that had been causing strife just ran out of fuel.

session_synopses.VB_ReadLedger: The player comments that a ledger they just read suggests the existence of a cellar; one they haven't found yet.
session_synopses.MagicMirror: Player finds a talking mirror that seems to be guarding a door to its old master's secret room. It doesn't recognise you as its master, so it challenges you with three questions to see if you're  friend or foe. If you get the questions wrong, it activates a trap to try and kill you. The mirror hasn't been used in a long time - its master died years ago. The mirror speaks in a cracked, broken voice.
session_synopses.VB_Trap: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player reacts to a booby trap they triggered - it just ran out of energy and they survived.

StatusFallback.speaker: Fezzerk
StatusFallback.text: What's this? Local wildlife havin' a gawk?
StatusFallback.context: CinematicNodeContext: NOTE: Camera should avoid showing the player as they could be in an unknown wildshape form here. Cinematic/look-at context - Fezzerk notices us and calls out to his cronies. (The line is addressed to the goblin raider and scavenger, but Fezzerk's attention is broadly held by the player (in wildshape animal form)InternalNodeContext: NOTE: Camera should avoid showing the player as they could be in an unknown wildshape form here.NodeContext: Cruel bravado + some surprise. Reacting to the player approaching while in animal form.

StatusFallback.speaker: Fezzerk
StatusFallback.text: Kill it - that thing'll roast up nicely for our supper.
StatusFallback.context: CinematicNodeContext: Waving on his fellow goblins to attack the player.InternalNodeContext: NOTE: Camera should avoid showing the player as they could be in an unknown wildshape form here.NodeContext: Urging his cronies to attack the player.

AD_InvestigateMill.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_InvestigateMill.text: Why's the spinnymajigger stopped? Get it moving again!
AD_InvestigateMill.context: NodeContext: Impatient and suspicious.The windmill that the goblins are using to torment their captive has stopped - their leader wants his cronies to investigate and get the windmill working again.

AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.text: Look's like the fun's over. C'mon, let's see who else we can snatch.
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.context: NodeContext: Calling to his assembled goblin cronies - 'c'mon fellas, let's wrap it up here.'

session_synopses.StatusFallback: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to an windmill and are watching him spin around. Here, the player approaches while using wildshape (they're in animal form, so the scene unfolds in a shortened manner that quickly turns to combat).
session_synopses.AD_InvestigateMill: Some goblins tormenting a gnome tied to a windmill are surprised when it stops rotating.
session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone: The goblins are leaving after witnessing their captive gnome get launched from the blade of a windmill at high speed. Now that their amusement's been catapulted away, they have no reason to linger.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
node_data.text: What do ya want? I'm not the one in charge.

session_synopses: A goblin raider, part of a patrol roaming the forest. Currently tormenting a deep gnome prisoner by tying him to a windmill. If the player gets too close, the goblin turns hostile - unless the player is a drow, in which case the goblin is servile.

AD_Vanish.speaker: Raphael
AD_Vanish.text: Bah! To hell with the devil, is it? Very well, I shall oblige.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: Send them to the dirt!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Preparing for battle - and excited for it.

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid). Delivery should be vicious and mean-spirited - they're torturing a helpless gnome for sport.

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The book radiates power, but the words you read in the Codex echo in your mind, guiding your eyes safely across the page.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The once-indecipherable glyphs now feel dangerously familiar, promising unholy power to those who can take it.*

Tome.speaker: Player
Tome.text: Read on and wrest the book's power from it.

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *As you parse the strange glyphs, you can feel the book resisting. Ghostly voices whisper at you from the dark - probing and fighting your mind.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *But your will is iron and you brush past these shades of the past, devouring every secret the book has to offer.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *You see now, life and death are malleable as clay, to be bent and reshaped by your will. By your power.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *But as you close the book, a nagging doubt whispers in your mind. What consequences will there be for calling the dead from their rest?*

PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.text: Sorry, but that book is spoken for - by me.

session_synopses.PAD_FindBook: PAD when you pick up 'The Necromancy of Thay' (DangerousBook_Tome.lsj). Character might have a sense that the book is evil or just be curious about what it might contain.
session_synopses.Tome: The player finds a book on necromancy - from one of the Red Wizards of Thay. Once read, the book will be bound to whoever tried to read it. Some origins will demand you let them read it, while others will want the book burned. If you read the book, you'll hear strange, distant whispers. The more you read, the stronger the voices will become, and the greater the chance that you'll be driven mad.
session_synopses.PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome: Plays if the player tries to take DangerousBook (The Necromancy of Thay) out of their companion's inventory when the book is bound to that companion (and therefore locked to their inventory). The PAD will play and the tome won't be removed. Only valid for Astarion, Gale, who want to keep the book and won't let anyone take it from them.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You hear another muffled cry. The two inside are still in the throes of... passion.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Open the door.

node_data.speaker: Grukkoh
node_data.text: Ngh. W-what the hells are you doin'?
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: A look of surprise and facination stretches across the player's face.
Offscreen the couple notices us, the camera catches them scrambling off as quickly as possible.NodeContext: Still busy with his ogress at first, then realises someone entered.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Apologies. I didn't mean to interrupt.

node_data.speaker: Buthir
node_data.text: Ruined! Smash - I'll SMASH YOU!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bugbear is getting off of the ogress and glares at me, if possible, he should be a bit ruffled. The ogress is behind hin and still getting up, adjusting the clothes around her waist. it should be clear they were having sex.NodeContext: The ogress is flying into a rage.

session_synopses.AD_BugbearKilled: The players have killed the bugbear (the Ogress' lover) and she swears revenge.
session_synopses: The player arrives at a house and hears a strange noise inside. It might sound like a fight is happening inside, but upon closer inspection they can learn that a bugbear and an ogre are making love.
session_synopses.AD_Combat: The bugbear shouts at the players after they barge in on the couple having sex.

AD_Plead.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_Plead.context: NodeContext: mocking barcus as he (barcus) flies on the windmill pane.

AD_Plead.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_Plead.context: NodeContext: Calling down to a goblin who has him captive on the windmill. Said while spinning on windmill.

SlowDown.speaker: Fezzerk
SlowDown.text: What's goin' on back there? Go check it out!
SlowDown.context: NodeContext: He turns to his right as he tells the other goblins to check it out.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.text: Come on! What are you waiting for?!
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: The gnome grows exasperated and panicky over the player's delay in cutting him free.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome is tied to the (stationary) sail of a wind, begging to be cut free by the player. He's close to the ground and within normal speaking range.NodeContext: Urgent, panicked. The gnome begs to be untied from the sail of a windmill. The sail is at the lowermost part of its rotation in relation to the ground, and the gnome is within normal speaking range.

TiedUp.speaker: Player
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Incredulous. His good samaritan seems to be haggling for a reward before even freeing him.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Impatient. He's used to being extorted.

AD_UnfortunateGnomePikeFail.speaker: Player
AD_UnfortunateGnomePikeFail.context: NodeContext: The player mutters to themselves as they struggle to untie a bound hostage in need of aid.
